remarks.para: Related articles: Modifying the Routing Strategy.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.SpeedToSpeedCat(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Convert a given speed to a speed category (SPEED_CAT). A lower speed category represents a faster rate of travel.
member.param: The speed to convert. This is measured in SPEED_UNITS units

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.Number
member.summary: The raw offset of this flag in the flags file

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.FUNC_CLASS
member.summary: Get the functional class of this link. Used to determine optimal routes.

remarks.para: The functional class, generally, has no direct correlation with road attributes (such as speed or type). However every link has at least one connection to another link with the same (or higher) functionality.

item.description: Roads with very few (if any) speed changes. High volume, maximum speed movement between or through major metropolitan area. Access is typically controlled
Roads with very few (if any) speed changes. High volume, high speed traffic movement, typically channeled to and from Class 1 roads
Interconnect Class 2 roads with a high volume of traffic at lower speeds
Traverse neighborhoods, carrying a high volume of traffic at moderate speeds

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.SPEED_CAT
member.summary: Get the speed classification of the link, based on posted or legal speed.
member.remarks:
Values from this list are used in calculating optimum routes.
char valuerepresents
1 Speeds greater than 130 kph / 80 mph.
2 101-130 kph / 65-80 mph.
3 91-100 kph / 55-64 mph.
4 71-90 kph / 41-54 mph.
5 51-70 kph / 31-40 mph.
6 31-50 kph / 21-30 mph.
7 11-30 kph / 6-20 mph.
8 Less than 11 kph / 6 mph.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.SPEED_LIM
member.summary: Speed limit on the street in local units.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.POSTED_SPEED
member.summary: Gets whether or not the SPEED_LIM represents a posted speed limit or an estimate

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.SPEED_UNITS
member.summary: The Units the speed limit is presented in.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.ImpliedSpeedLimit
member.summary: Get a speed limit estimate that is determined by additional flag data if the actual speed limit is not known.
member.remarks:
The value is returned in units specified by the SPEED_UNITS attribute.
If the speed limit for this section of the route cannot be found then -1 is returned.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.LANE_CAT
member.summary: Get character representing the number of lanes in this link.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.DIVIDER
member.summary: Get the effect of the divider (if present) on turning.
member.remarks:
Descriptions given below are for right-side driving countries. For left-side driving countries simply reverse left and right.
char valuerepresents
L Line/Polyline only. Turns are allowed at either end, but U-Turns are not allowed along the line/polyline.
A Line/Polyline and the intersections at both ends. Left-turns and u-turns are not allowed along the line/polyline.
1 Line/Polyline and the reference intersection. Left turns and u-turns are not allowed at the reference intersection. U-turns are not allowed along the length of the divider.
2 Line/Polyline and the non-reference intersection. Left turns and u-turns are not allowed at the non-reference intersection. U-turns are not allowed along the length of the divider.
N No divider. No restriction on turns.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.DIR_TRAVEL
member.summary: Get a char representing the direction of travel on the link.
member.remarks:
Possible values:
char valueRepresents
B Travel is allowed in both directions.
F Direction of travel is one way from the reference end of the link to the non-reference end.
T Direction of travel is one way from the non-reference end of the link to the reference end.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.FERRY_TYPE
member.summary: Get if the link is part of a ferry route. For display purposes only.
member.remarks:
Possible values:
char valueRepresents
B Link is a part of a boat ferry route
R Link is a part of a rail ferry route
H Link is a part of a street route

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.ROUTE_TYPE
member.summary: Get whether this road is part of a larger route, where the road's name is actually a route number. The return value determines the type of the road. See remarks
member.remarks:
Possible values:
char valueRepresents
(space) Not applicable
1 U.S. interstate or European level 1 road
2 U.S. federal or European level 2 road
3 U.S. state or European level 3 road
4 U.S. county or European level 4 road
5 European level 5 road
6 European level 6 road

member.summary: Get the type of numbering this link uses

member.summary: Gets the country

member.summary: Get if the link has mixed numbering on the left side
member.remarks: Mixed numbering means that no all-odd or all-even numbering scheme is followed.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.RADDR_MIXED
member.summary: Get if the link has mixed numbering on the right side
member.remarks: Mixed numbering means that no all-odd or all-even numbering scheme is followed.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.AR_TRUCK
member.summary: Get if trucks are allowed on this link

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.AR_TRAFF
member.summary: Get if through traffic is allowed on this link. False for links that are internal to a parking lot or are either on a military facility or privately maintained roads and do not allow public thoroughfare. Public streets with posted or legal restrictions such as "No Through Traffic" or "Residents Only" are also included in this class.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.AR_DELIV
member.summary: Get if delivery vehicles are allowed on this link

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.AR_EMERVEH
member.summary: Get if emergency vehicles are allowed on this link

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.PAVED
member.summary: Get if the link is paved

member.summary: Get if the link is a private road

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.FRONTAGE
member.summary: Get if the link is a frontage road

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.BRIDGE
member.summary: Get if the link is a bridge

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.TUNNEL
member.summary: Get if the link is a tunnel

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.RAMP
member.summary: Get if the link is a ramp

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.TOLLWAY
member.summary: Get if the link is a tollway

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.POIACCESS
member.summary: Get if the link is an access road to a Point Of Interest

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.CONTRACC
member.summary: Get if the link is a controlled-access road. Typically high-speed, high-volume roads with limited entries and exits

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.ROUNDABOUT
member.summary: Get if link is part of a roundabout

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.INTERINTER
member.summary: Get if this link is present within an intersection to maintain its structure, rather than as a part of any of the converging streets
member.remarks: The driver may perceive the intersection in a different way to that which the converging street links would imply. Thus additional or different instructions may need to be provided to drivers if INTERINTER for a link is set to true.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.UNDEFTRAFF
member.summary: Get if link is an undefined traffic area. See remarks
member.remarks: An undefined traffic area is a paved area where a car can legally travel but there are no defined traffic patterns. For example, a carpark.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.MULTIDIGIT
member.summary: Get if this link is one side of a multiply digitised street
member.remarks: Multiply digitised streets occur when opposing lanes of traffic are digitised as separate street links.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.MAXATTR
member.summary: Get if the street has been encoded to include the maximum number of attributes for a link

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.SPECTRFIG
member.summary: Get if there is a special traffic figure. See remarks
member.remarks: Indicates an intersection similar to a roundabout, where traffic flows are not consistent around the circle. Example: A roundabout where the number of lanes changes.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.INDESCRIB
member.summary: Get if the intersection complexity is such that substantial guidance information will be required
member.remarks: This may occur in very complex intersection situations

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.MANOEUVRE
member.summary: Get if this link represents a single driving maneuver, for example "turn right".
member.remarks: If this value is false, this link may not be navigable in a single maneuver.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.DIVIDERLEG
member.summary: Get if the divider on this link is a legal divider, not a physical barrier e.g. painted road lines.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.INPROCDATA
member.summary: Get if the link has full geometry, but has an incomplete attribute specification

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.FULL_GEOM
member.summary: Get if this link has a full geometry of the road network around it

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.URBAN
member.summary: Get if this link is in a developed or built up urban area. Always false for US
member.remarks: For the US this always returns false.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.JUNCTIONNM
member.summary: Get if the name of this link is applied to all ramps that make up a specific junction

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteFlag.EXITNUMBER
member.summary: Get if the name of this link is an exit number, e.g. as on a freeway exit sign

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LocalGeoCoder.ReverseGeoCodeFull(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,System.String[])
member.summary: Find a from a given and last known location.
member.remarks: This method uses the last known location (usually from a previous GeoCode) to improve the precision of the Reverse GeoCode. This method works well when a number of routes overlap and a decision must be made as to which route the point lies on.
member.param: A to resolve.
An array containing name(s) of the last known location.

member.param: A to resolve.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LocalGeoCoder.ReverseGeoCodeFull(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,System.String[],System.Double,System.Boolean,Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeMode)
member.summary: Find a from a given , last location and distance from the last location.
member.remarks: The global flag controls the fallback state of the query. If global is true and the location cannot be resolved to a street address then the nearest city within 10 degrees is returned. This means that a successful resolution is almost certainly guaranteed (unless the is located in an ocean), however there is a significant performance hit in finding the nearest city.
member.param: A to resolve.
An array containing name(s) of the last known location.
The distance (measured in degrees) from the last known location to present location.
If true and an address cannot be found a nearby city is returned. If false and an address cannot be found, the Reverse GeoCode will return a null . See Remarks.
The type of streets that should be returned by this geocode.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.Location
member.summary: The to resolve.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.Speed
member.summary: The vehicle's current speed in mp/h. Defaults to -1 (unused).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.Global
member.summary: This flag controls the fallback state of the query. If global is true and the location cannot be resolved to a street address then the nearest city within 10 degrees is returned. This means that a successful resolution is almost certainly guaranteed (unless the is located in an ocean), however there is a significant performance hit in finding the nearest city. Defaults to true.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.Mode
member.summary: The type of streets that should be returned by this geocode. Defaults to .

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.CrossStreetDist
member.summary: The maximum distance in degrees to search for a cross street. Defaults to 0.01 but this default my be changed through the get/set methods in Geocoder.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.Heading
member.summary: A heading (measured in degrees). Defaults to infinity (unused).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.LastNames
member.summary: An array containing name(s) of the last known location. Defaults to null (unused).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.MaxDistance
member.summary: ReverseGeoCodeFull will return null if there are no results within MaxDistance degrees of the input location . Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeArgs.AlignSearchLimit
member.summary: The distance (in meters) after which vehicle alignment is not considered. Defaults to 30.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoCoder
member.summary: The GeoCoder allows you to convert a map coordinate to/from an address.

remarks.para: Forward geocoding takes physical address information in string form, and returns a coordinate. Use an overload of the method to peform a forward geocode.

Reverse geocoding takes a coordinate and returns physical address information. Use an overload of the method to obtain an object (street name, suburb, city and other regional information). For more detailed information about the map coordinate consider using an overload of the method to obtain a object (this includes an Address object, but also provides information about the nearest street section and the timezone of the map coordinate).
Related articles: Geocoding Concept, Searching for a Location, Common Concepts, Creating a Route, Routing and Directions.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoCoder.ReverseGeoCode(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Reverse geocode from a to a street . This method will return null if an address could not be found.

remarks.para: The geocoder will find the nearest street to the given location, or the nearest location to the given street address.
The street number is calculated using the nearest point on the street, and may be interpolated where data is unavailable.
If this method returns null check that you have map data for the location (LatLon) you are reverse geocoding.
Related articles: Geocoding Concept, Reverse Geocoding.

member.example: See for an example of reverse geocode usage.
member.param: Location to find.
member.returns: An or null.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoCoder.SetCrossStreetDistance(System.Double,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Set the maximum distance to search for a cross street when doing a full reverse GeoCode.
member.param: The maximum distance to search for a cross street, in the units specified
The units to return the distance in
member.remarks: Cross streets can be found by inspecting the member in the result of a reverse geocode full. By setting this distance to a higher number, the street will be searched further to find a cross street. A longer search involves more processing, and subsequently takes longer to execute.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoCoder.ReverseGeoCode(Telogis.GeoBase.Vector,Telogis.GeoBase.Vector,Telogis.GeoBase.Address)
member.summary: Generate a more accurate by reverse geocoding based on the last known location, heading and speed.

remarks.para: By providing additional location information it is possible for the geocoder to correct inaccuracies in the GPS data.

An example: Imagine that the current reported vehicle location is on an underpass that runs perpendicular to a freeway. If the geocoder knows that the last known location of the vehicle was on the freeway, it can use this additional information to work out that the vehicle is in fact still on the freeway. This is useful when GPS inaccuracies would otherwise place the vehicle in a location that it could not logically be at. This information is provided by LastLocation and LastAddress.

member.param: The current location data.
Last know location (or null).
The last known (probably returned by a previous call to this function).
member.returns: An or null.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseHelper.GetIsolationKey(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a key that isolates the license for the given type when the type is used by more than one assembly in the same process.
member.param: The type that requires a license.
The instance of that type (or a derived type) that is requesting the license.
member.returns: Returns a key that uniquely identifies the isolation level for the type and assembly.
member.remarks: Normally XHEO|Licensing will track validated licenses per assembly so that a license granted for a given type in one assembly is not necessarily considered valid for a different assembly in the same process. The isolation key is used to uniquely identify the context for the type and instance. If the key returned is null, then the default isolation rules will be applied.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.PeriodicLicenseChecksAttribute
member.summary: Allows a developer to declaritively limit the license validation check frequency of an .
member.remarks:
Often the validation process of a component license can be computationally expensive. To limit the impact of using licensed components they can be set to only check periodically.
There are two general types of license validations. Local checks that the limits of the license are valid for the current process and that the license has not yet expired. Remote checks to see if the license has been revoked by the issuer. Not all license have a remote limit. If not present, then the remote value has no meaning.
A value of -1 (the default) for either type indicates that that type should be checked every time a license is requested for the component.

Time in milliseconds between remote checks.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.ImageUtils.ImageCompressor
member.summary: Utility class to save file space by compressing images.
member.remarks: The ImageCompressor can be used to reduce the file size of images by reducing their color count to 8 bits-per-pixel (256 colors). The most used colors are kept and other colors are mapped to the nearest kept color.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.ImageUtils.ImageCompressor.QuantizeTo8bpp(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Color[])
member.summary: Reduce file size by converting a 32bpp palletized map to an 8bpp indexed map.
member.remarks:
Use of this method will generally give a 25-50 percent reduction in file size when saved as a PNG. You should of the source image if you are no longer using it.
If your map has more than 256 colors the "best fit" pallette will be found.
member.param: The 32bit source .
A list of colors to find nearest approximations for in the new image. These will be modified in place
member.returns: A 8bit map.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.ImageUtils.ImageCompressor.QuantizeTo8bpp(System.Drawing.Image)
member.summary: Reduce file size by converting a 32bpp palletized map to an 8bpp indexed map.
member.remarks:
Use of this method will generally give a 25-50 percent reduction in file size when saved as a PNG. You should of the source image if you are no longer using it.
If your map has more than 256 colors the "best fit" pallette will be found.
member.param: The 32bit source .
member.returns: A 8bit map.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ReverseGeoCodeMode.AllLinks
member.summary: Search will return all streets.

summary.para: Search will return only streets with names.
Typically, a street without a name will be one of:

ul.li: A street that is internal to an intersection. These streets do not physically exist but are created to accurately describe an intersection (for example, a right-turn-only lane may be digitized as a separate street to maintain the validity of the intersection).
A street that is in a remote location and genuinely has no name (such as a farm track, or a unsealed road following a river).

summary.para: Search will return only streets that are 'real'.

Typically, a street that is not real will be a street that is internal to an intersection. These streets do not physically exist but are created to accurately describe an intersection (for example, a right-turn-only lane may be digitized as a separate street to maintain the validity of the intersection).

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.GBDiagnostics.MemoryTracker
member.summary: Tracks IntPtrs to help identify leaks of memory allocated by managed code. To use, call MemoryTracker.Dump() at a point during processing when you expect there to be no outstanding explicitly allocated memory. If there is any outstanding explicitly allocated memory then the stack traces of the calls to allocate that memory will be output to the console. You should also check that there are no direct calls to Marshal.AllocHGlobal, Marshal.AllocCoTaskMem, Marshal.FreeHGlobal, Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem and Marshal.StringToHGlobalAnsi. All such calls should go via the appropriate methods in the GBMarshal class. Memory tracking is enabled in debug mode and when MEMORY_TRACKING is #defined.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.IMapRenderer
member.summary: Supports rendering user-defined features onto a map. RendererList class IMap.Renderer property
member.remarks:
This interface is implemented by types that are to draw additional features onto a map.
To use a renderer, assign an object that implements to the property of an object. When the map is redrawn it will invoke the method of the .
Multiple renderers can be attached to a single by using a .
Related articles: Renderers Tutorial, Renderer Walk-Through, Render Modes in Detail, Routing Concept, Using a Navigator, Using a LabelBox, How Renderers Work, Defining the Renderer, Using Multiple Renderers.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.IMapRenderer.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,Telogis.GeoBase.RenderContext)
member.summary: Called when this item should render itself on the map.
member.param: The object that can be used to draw on the map.
The information for this call.
member.remarks:
The method is called every time a map it is assigned to is redrawn, including when it is zoomed or panned.
The parameter supplies information to this method about the state of rendering, and also provides methods for:
Reserving space on the map for the rendering of this item.
Testing whether rendering this item would cause a collision or overlap with space previously reserved by another item.
The property can be used to convert coordinates to screen coordinates for rendering, using
Related articles: Map Concept, Defining the Renderer.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.IMapRenderer.RequiredRendermodes
member.summary: Specifies which stages of rendering should this renderer be called.
member.remarks:
The RenderMode values are a set of flags that specify which stages of rendering should a renderer's Render method be called. For example, before the map draws its labels, it would call all its renderers whose RequiredRendermodes property returned RenderMode.Prelabelling.
A renderer can also be called at multiple stages of the rendering process. This is achieved by using the 'or' operator (|) to specify any additional stages the renderer should be called.
return RenderMode.Prelabelling | RenderMode.Labelling;
Whenever a renderer is used in multiple stages of the rendering process, it is possible to find out which stage the renderer is currently in using the RenderContext.Mode property that is passed in to the Render() method.

member.summary: A rectangular GeoFence.

example.para: The example above uses RectangleBox.Box to set the dimensions of the RectangleFence. You can use RectangleBox.Box to manipulate the RectangleFence. Do not try to manipulate the RectangleFence using its BoundingBox property. RectangleBox.BoundingBox returns a copy of the RectangleFence, so changing its property has no effect on the RectangleFence.
The same geofence can also be created using only XAML code. See for an example.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.LocalRepository
member.summary: An abstract class representing one or more local data sources providing GeoBase services (such as routing and mapping). To provide a local data source use either a or a .

remarks.para: Use a to represent multiple local data sources (GBFS files) and a to represent a single local data source (one GBFS file).
Both MultiRepository and SimpleRepository inherit from LocalRepository, so may be used in place of a LocalRepository.
Related articles: Using Repositories to manage data.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.Repository
member.summary: A Repository is used to manage GeoBase data. This data is required to support GeoBase services (such as routing and mapping). Each thread in your application may have its own Repository. See remarks.

remarks.para: The default repository used for this application should be set using the method.
The current thread's Repository may be set using the method to one of: , or .
A default Repository may be set for all newly-created threads using the property. You may then use the property to override the Repository used on a per-thread basis.
The Repository may be changed on-the-fly.
Related articles: Using Repositories to manage data.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.HistoricalTrafficSource
member.summary: This class supports historical traffic data, contained within GBHB files.

remarks.para: Related articles: Adding a Traffic Layer, Routing with Traffic.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.ITrafficSource
member.summary: Implemented to resolve a given TMC code and DateTime to a TrafficInfo.

remarks.para:
The ITrafficSource interface is implemented to resolve a given TMC (Traffic Message Channel) code and DateTime to a TrafficInfo. A Traffic object will have one or more traffic sources which will be implemented with the ITrafficSource interface. Telogis GeoBase provides classes with implementations of this interface in support of the following traffic data:
INRIX - incident, predictive, real
NAVTEQ - incident, predictive, real For more information, see:

Additional traffic data sources can be added with the ITrafficSource interface. The interface exposes the GetTrafficInfo method, and the property. To implement this interface, code must be provided for both GetTrafficInfo, and CreatedTime.
CreatedTime - gets DateTime when the traffic data was created.

GetTrafficInfo - this method returns the for the given TMC code at the specified DateTime. The speed can be found from the traffic source data by searching for the given TMC code with the given time, and then extracting the speed from the found TMC code.
Related articles: Routing with Traffic.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.IGenericTrafficSource
member.summary: Provides a common ancestor for all Traffic Source interfaces. Traffic Source interfaces are implemented to resolve a source of traffic data and a DateTime value to a TrafficInfo.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.ITrafficSource.GetTrafficInfo(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Implemented by derived classes to resolve a given TMC and DateTime to a TrafficInfo.
member.param: the TMC code to resolve
the DateTime to get the for
member.returns: The TrafficInfo for the given TMC code at the specified DateTime

remarks.para: The TMC codes supplied to an ITrafficSource in the GetTrafficInfo call have the format ABCCDEEEEE (for example: -126N04295) where:

td.para: + = in the positive direction and external to the problem location
- = in the negative direction and external to the problem location
P = in the positive direction and internal to the problem location
N = in the negative direction and internal to the problem location

remarks.para: For many sources of traffic data, the initial + or - (labeled A above) will not be present and so can be stripped off.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.ITrafficSource.GetTrafficInfo(System.String,System.DateTime,Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone)
member.summary: Implemented by derived classes to resolve a given TMC code and DateTime to a TrafficInfo.
member.param: the TMC code to resolve
the DateTime to get the for. This will be UTC
The timezone this TMC code exists in. This can be used to convert the UTC time passed in to the local time for that TMC code
member.returns: The TrafficInfo for the given TMC code at the specified DateTime

remarks.para: The TMC codes supplied to an ITrafficSource in the GetTrafficInfo call have the format ABCCDEEEEE (for example: -126N04295) where:

td.para: + = in the positive direction and external to the problem location
- = in the negative direction and external to the problem location
P = in the positive direction and internal to the problem location
N = in the negative direction and internal to the problem location

remarks.para: For many sources of traffic data, the initial + or - (labeled A above) will not be present and so can be stripped off.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEditDatabase.CreateLinkEdit(Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.ILinkEditSelection,System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Adds a new link edit to the database, and returns it.

remarks.para: When applied, speeds will be converted into miles per hour and rounded down to the largest integer value that is no larger than the specified speed. A negative speed can be applied, and indicates that the original speed from strategy's RoutingProfile will be used. The maximum speed that can be specified is 254mph.
If the returned LinkEdit object is changed, the change will only be applied to the database if UpdateLinkEdit is called.

member.param: The ILinkEditSelection that selects the links to be edited.
The speed to apply.
The units for speed.
member.returns: The LinkEdit that was added to the database.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaveAnnouncer.SayMovement(Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationEvent,Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationEvent)
member.summary: Announce the next (pending) navigation movement to the user.

remarks.para: If the pending movement is within 500 meters and the next movement is within 300m then both movements are announced, eg "Turn left at the traffic lights then turn sharp right at the end of the street" is played.
If we are within 3 seconds or 30 meters of an event, or the movement has already been announced we play a bell.

member.param: The current (pending) navigation event.
The navigation event after the current event.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaveAnnouncer.SayMovement(Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationEvent,Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationEvent,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Announce the next (pending) navigation movement to the user.

remarks.para: If the pending movement is within 500 meters and the next movement is within 300m then both movements are announced, eg "Turn left at the traffic lights then turn sharp right at the end of the street" is played.
If we are within 3 seconds or 30 meters of an event, or the movement has already been announced we play a bell.

member.param: The current (pending) navigation event.
The navigation event after the current event.
Force the movement to be announced even if it was recently announced.

member.summary: Get a Dictionary containing details of the available cultures. The keys in the Dictionary are the formal names of the cultures, for example "en-US". member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Geometry.Polygon
member.summary: Represents a closed polygonal area such as a lake or national park.

remarks.para: A polygon feature is made up of a number of s. The OuterRing property forms the external boundary of the polygon. One or more InnerRings may be specified to add holes or islands within the polygon.
A ring must contain at least 4 points. The first and last points must be equal.

A simple polygon like a lake might only have an OuterRing, which describes the outline of the lake. A lake with an island in the middle of it is represented by a polygon with an OuterRing and an a single InnerRing for the island. Furthermore, A lake with an island with a lake would be represented by a polygon with an OuterRing and two InnerRings.
The winding of polygons is irrelevant, however by convention filled areas are oriented clockwise while holes are oriented counter-clockwise.
Intersecting InnerRings must be merged into a single Ring.
Related articles: Data Query Concept.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Geometry.Polygon.PythagoreanDistanceTo(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Returns the Pythagorean distance from the given location to the edge of this Polygon, in the specified units. If the given location is inside this Polygon, the distance returned will be zero. See remarks for comments on the accuracy of this method.
member.remarks: The Pythagorean distance assumes that the world is flat between the edge of this Polygon and the given location. This assumption is safe when the Polygon and location are near each other. If the Polygon and location are a significant distance apart the straight line between the Polygon and the point will pass through the interior of the world. To calculate the true shortest distance consider using the DistanceTo method. The DistanceTo method calculates the distance using a great circle which traces an arc over the surface of the earth.
member.param: The location whose distance from the polygon you want to know.
The result will be measured in these units
member.returns: Shortest distance from loc to the edge of this Polygon in units units, or zero if loc is inside the Polygon.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Geometry.Polygon.DistanceTo(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Returns the shortest distance from the given location to the edge of this Polygon, in the specified units. If the given location is inside this Polygon, the distance returned will be zero. This is calculated using the great circle distance.
member.param: The location whose distance from the polygon you want to know.
The result will be measured in these units
member.returns: Shortest distance from loc to the edge of this Polygon in units units, or zero if loc is inside the Polygon.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.Traffic
member.summary: A Traffic is a collection of traffic sources which may be queried to determine the speed of traffic along a given link.

remarks.para: A Traffic is a collection of traffic sources, implemented using the interface, which may be queried to determine the speed of traffic along a given link.
See to query the speed of traffic along a link.

The speed value returned using will be the lowest value found for the given link ID and time. If more than one traffic source is specified, the traffic sources will be searched in order of priority. The order of priority is simply the order in which the traffic sources are listed when implementing the collection.
See the Traffic tutorial for more detailed information on using the Traffic class.
Related articles: Routing with Traffic.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingProfile
member.summary: Used to determine the speed profile (based on functional class and speed category) when routing. See remarks.
member.remarks: Travel speed is often a function of both functional class and speed category.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingProfile.#ctor
member.summary: Parameterless constructor. Creates a default routing profile where travel speed is only a function of the speed category.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingProfile.#ctor(System.Double[],Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Constructs a custom speed routing profile.

param.name: speeds
param.para: A one-dimensional array of 48 doubles representing the travel speed for each functional class and speed category combination.

The array is constructed in six consecutive blocks of eight elements. Each block represents a functional class (1-6), the first block represents functional class 1, the second block functional class 2, etc.
The first element in the each block corresponds to speed category 1, the second element speed category 2, etc.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategy.ExtraProcessingRatio
member.summary: Used to increase the area of the bounding boxes for querying the network.
member.remarks:
This value represents the multiplier for the size of the area that routing will look at when locating the optimum path. Valid values are 1 to 100; the default is 1. 100 means the area looked at is 100 times larger than the default.
It should be noted that increasing the search area will also increase the memory requirements and the amount of time it takes to create a route.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategy.LinkEdits
member.summary: A set of link edits that, for selected links, will override the default speed that is used when calculating a route.

remarks.para: To use this feature, create a LinkEditDatabase and create appropriate LinkEdit objects using the CreateLinkEdit method. Once ready, call Compile to create a CompiledLinkEdits object that can be assigned to this property.
Alternatively, a CompiledLinkEdits can be created from a pre-existing LinkEditDatabase file by calling CompiledLinkEdits.Create.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkCost.UndesirableLink
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this link should be avoided.
member.remarks:
If this is true, the routing engine may still traverse this link, but only if all other options have been exhausted.
Related articles: Modifying the Routing Strategy.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkCost.ProhibitedLink
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this link must be avoided unless no other route exists

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteCustomEval
member.summary: A function that can evaluate the link flags and return an additional cost for travel on a link with those flags. It is passed the start and end points of the link, the length of the link in meters and the flags for the current link as well as the flags for the link the route is just coming off.
member.remarks:
Supply a delegate with this signature in order to perform custom routing. The parameter will have the routing strategy's estimate of the cost for the link when your method is called. You should make any relevant adjustments to this value before you return that represent the cost of traversing this link.
Related articles: Modifying the Routing Strategy.
member.param: The of the start of the candidate link
The of the end of the candidate link
The length of the candidate link in meters
The s for the candidate link
The s for the previous link. This may be null if this is the first link
The LinkId for the candidate link. When routing on Navteq data, this is the Navteq Link ID
The total cost of the route so far, up to the start of this link
The cost of the candidate link. This will be populated when this delegate is called, and the delegate should adjust it as necessary
The used to evaluate the cost of the route.
The time (always UTC) at which the routing is performed.
The timezone in which the routing along the link is performed. This value should be used to convert dateTime (UTC) to local time.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteCustomCostFunc
member.summary: A function that can evaluate information about a link and return an additional cost for travel on that link.
member.remarks:
Supply a delegate with this signature in order to perform custom routing. The parameter will have the routing strategy's estimate of the cost for the link when your method is called. You should make any relevant adjustments to this value before you return that represent the cost of traversing this link.
Related articles: Modifying the Routing Strategy.
member.param: A containing the flags for a link.
The cost of the candidate link. This will be populated when this delegate is called, and the delegate should adjust it as necessary

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyFastest
member.summary: A which calculates the fastest route between s.

remarks.para: Related articles: Routing Concept, Using a RouteMatrix.

member.summary: Frees all (managed & unmanaged) resources associated with this .

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyFastest.Finalize
member.summary: The destructor frees all unmanaged resources associated with this .

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyFastest.UTurnPenalty
member.summary: The penalty applied during routing for performing a u-turn. The default cost is 20 seconds.
member.remarks: This is detrimental to the performance of routing so has max value of 300 seconds.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyFastest.CrossingTurnPenalty
member.summary: The penalty applied during routing for making a turn that crosses traffic. So in a country that drives on the right side of the road, left turns will be penalised if they cross a lane of traffic. Default is no penalty.
member.remarks: This is detrimental to the performance of routing so has max value of 300 seconds.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyFastest.CrossAtTrafficSignalsUnpenalized
member.summary: If traffic signal data is available and a crossing turn is being performed at an intersection controlled by traffic lights, allow a crossing turn to be performed with no penalty.
member.remarks: This means the Crossing Turn Penalty, if there is one, will not be applied. This is a best effort feature as we are limited to the traffic signal data supplied to us.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyShortest

member.summary: Gets the units in which the cost for this strategy is calculated in (always returns meters).

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyShortest.EnhanceRoute
member.summary: When true, routing will consider more minor streets close to the direct line between two consecutive route stops. This is likely to improve the quality of shortest routes, but at the price of some impact on performance and memory usage.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategyForPedestrian
member.summary: A that calculates the shortest route between s.

remarks.para: The routing strategy for pedestrians assumes an average walking speed (3 mph/5 kph), allows a route to traverse one-way streets in either direction, checks the flag, and avoids streets with a of 1 or 2.
Related articles: Routing Concept, Using a RouteMatrix.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.ArrivalMovement
member.summary: A movement that occurs on arrival at the destination.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.ArrivalMovement.Destination
member.summary: A description of the destination. This can either be the of a RouteStop, or it can be the name of the last street followed to arrive at the destination.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.ArrivalMovement.Number
member.summary: The street number of the destination when it is given as a street name. If the destination is given as a RouteStop description, or if the street number does not exist or is unknown, this value is null.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.ArrivalMovement.Direction
member.summary: If the final movement when arriving at the destination is to turn off the street, this is the direction to turn. Otherwise, this is TurnDirection.None.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.ArrivalMovement.PrevDistance
member.summary: The amount of distance to travel after leaving the final street in the directions.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.ArrivalMovement.PrevStreet
member.summary: If the final movement when arriving at the destination is to turn off a street, this is the name of the street to exit. Otherwise, this is an empty string.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Geocoding.IExternalGeocoders.SetDefaultExternalGeocoder(Telogis.GeoBase.Geocoding.IExternalGeocoder)
member.summary: A default geocoder can provide geocoding services for any country. Only one default geocoder can be set at a time. When a default geocoder is already set any calls to this method will have no effect. To change the default geocoder you must first call , then set the desired default geocoder and any other external geocoders.
member.remarks: External geocoders are used by GeoBase as a fall-back when the GeoBase geocoder does not return any results.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Geocoding.IExternalGeocoders.SetExternalGeocoderForCountry(Telogis.GeoBase.Geocoding.IExternalGeocoder,Telogis.GeoBase.Country)
member.summary: Use this method to set an external geocoder to provide geocoding services for only one country. Of course you can call this method with multiple countries, but the same external geocoder, to use that external geocoder to provide geocoding services for multiple selected countries. Use the method to set an external geocoder to provide geocoding services for all countries.
member.remarks: External geocoders are used by GeoBase as a fall-back when the GeoBase geocoder does not return any results.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Geocoding.ExternalGeocoders.m_externalGeocoderCountryMapping
member.summary: Mapping from country to external geocoder. Must be locked during all accesses.

member.summary: Provides the single instance of ExternalGeocoders

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GBMarshal.StringToHGlobalAnsi(System.String)
member.summary: Copies the contents of a managed System.String into unmanaged memory, converting into ANSI format as it copies. When memory tracking is enabled, tracks the unmanaged memory to make it easier to identify leaks.
member.param: The managed string to be copied.
member.returns: The address, in unmanaged memory, to where the string was copied. The unmanaged memory must be freed with GBMarshal.FreeHGlobal.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GBMarshal.AllocHGlobal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates memory from the unmanaged memory of the process and, when memory tracking is enabled, tracks it to make it easier to identify leaks. Use this method rather than calling Marshal.AllocHGlobal directly.
member.param: The number of bytes in memory required.
member.returns: An IntPtr to the newly allocated memory. This memory must be released using GBMarshal.FreeHGlobal(IntPtr).

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GBMarshal.FreeHGlobal(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees memory previously allocated from the unmanaged memory of the process and, when memory tracking is enabled, stops tracking it. Use this method rather than calling Marshal.FreeHGlobal directly.
member.param: The handle to the allocated memory.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GBMarshal.AllocCoTaskMem(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates memory from the COM task memory allocator and, when memory tracking is enabled, tracks it to make it easier to identify leaks. Use this method rather than calling Marshal.AllocCoTaskMem directly.
member.param: The number of bytes in memory required.
member.returns: An IntPtr to the newly allocated memory. This memory must be released using GBMarshal.FreeCoTaskMem(IntPtr).

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GBMarshal.FreeCoTaskMem(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees memory previously allocated from the COM task memory allocator and, when memory tracking is enabled, stops tracking it. Use this method rather than calling Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem directly.
member.param: The handle to the allocated memory.

member.summary: Creates a MovementCategorizer that uses the default images. Images should be available in your TurnIcons folder.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.MovementCategorizer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a MovementCategorizer that uses images from a specified folder. The images should be in PNG format.
member.param: The path for the folder that contains the images for displaying different movements.

remarks.para: The images folder should contain the following images (in png, bmp, gif, or jpeg format):

item.description: Uturn by going around a traffic circle in left-hand traffic.
Uturn by going around a traffic circle in right-hand traffic.
Turn left at the traffic circle in left-hand traffic.
Turn left at the traffic circle in right-hand traffic.
Turn right at the traffic circle in left-hand traffic.
Turn right at the traffic circle in right-hand traffic.
Go straight through the traffic circle in left-hand traffic.
Go straight through the traffic circle in right-hand traffic.
Make a uturn in left-hand traffic (by turning right).
Make a uturn in right-hand traffic (by turning left).

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.CustomTable
member.summary: Describes a table in a custom data file.

remarks.para: A table could record, for example, the location, type and ID number of a set of power pylons. Also see .

para.b: Some table names are predefined and reserved for use by the GeoBase engine. These predefined table names are:

remarks.para: Related articles: Data Query Concept.

example.code: CustomTable NWPylons = new CustomTable(); NWPylons.Name = "North-Western Power Pylons"; // user-defined label NWPylons.Type = "Point"; // the type of data: one of "Line", "Polygon", "Point". Case-sensitive NWPylons.Columns[0] = pylonType; // an object of type CustomColumn NWPylons.Columns[1] = dateLastInspected; // another CustomColumn

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.CustomTable.Name
member.summary: The user-defined name of the table. Some table names are predefined and should be avoided - see .

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.CustomTable.Type
member.summary: A string describing the datatype of the table. One of: "Line, Polygon, Point" (case-sensitive).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.CustomTable.Columns
member.summary: An array of the columns in this table.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.CustomIndex
member.summary: Describes an index in a custom data file.

remarks.para: Related articles: Data Query Concept.

example.code: CustomIndex MyIndex = new CustomIndex(); MyIndex.Name = "North-West Power Pylons"; // A user-defined index name. MyIndex.TableName = "InspectionTable"; // A user-defined table name. MyIndex.Type = "Point"; // The type of data to index. Same as the type of column it is indexing (the custom column). MyIndex.Column = "PylonLocation"; // A user-defined custom column name.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficRouting.RecalculateRouteTime(Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.Directions,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Recalculate (by accounting for traffic congestion) the time required to travel a given route (specified as Directions) starting at a given time.
member.param: The route to travel.
The time at which the journey is to start.
member.returns: The calculated time at which the journey will end. The chronological length of the journey may be determined from the difference between the return value and the given startTime parameter.

member.param: The route to travel.
The location along the route at which the journey begins.
The time at which the journey is to start.
member.returns: The calculated time at which the journey will end. The chronological length of the journey may be determined from the difference between the return value and the given startTime parameter.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit
member.summary: Represents a link edit (a customization of one or more street links to affect routing). A link edit may affect more than one link. For example, one created using a LatLonSelection without a heading, or one created using a PolygonSelection.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Transactional.Table,Telogis.GeoBase.Transactional.Record)
member.summary: Create a link with a table and the record it belongs to
member.param: The link edit database table.
The record in the table that describes the link edit.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Transactional.Table,Telogis.GeoBase.Transactional.Record,System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.ILinkEditSelection,System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Create a link from its base information (priority, selection, speed and unit) and the record it belongs to
member.param: The link edit database table
The record in the table that describes the link edit.
The priority of the link edit. Link edits with larger priority values are applied in preference to link edits for the same street link with smaller priorities.
The class that determines which street links the edit applies to.
The speed limit assigned to the link edit.
The units to use when interpreting speed.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit.SetSpeed(System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Sets the speed that will be applied to the links affected by this edit.
member.remarks: When applied, speeds will be converted into miles per hour and rounded down to the largest integer value that is no larger than the specified speed. A negative speed can be applied, and indicates that the original speed from strategy's RoutingProfile will be used. The maximum speed that can be specified is 254mph.
member.param: The speed to apply.
The units for speed.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit.GetSpeed(Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Gets the speed that will be applied to the links affected by this edit.
member.remarks: A negative speed can be returned, and indicates that the original speed from strategy's RoutingProfile will be used.
member.param: The units in which to return the result.
member.returns: The speed that will be applied.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit.Priority
member.summary: Determines the link edit's priority. Edits with a larger Priority value are applied in preference to those with a smaller Priority value. If two edits have the same Priority value then the behavior is undefined.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LinkEdit.Selection
member.summary: The ILinkEditSelection that selects the links that will be affected by this edit.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.MapStyle
member.summary: A map style is a compiled representation of a Chameleon script. For more information on writing Chameleon scripts, see the Chameleon section of the User's Guide.

remarks.para: Related articles: Chameleon Custom Map Styles.

example.para: The code example below uses the Create(String) method to instantiate a MapStyle object. This method will return null if any errors occur. Overloads of the Create() method, such as allow the compile errors (if any) to be inspected.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MapStyle.HasParameter(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if a specified parameter exists. The parameter will be specified in the Chameleon .CAM file using the PARAMETER %param = 1 syntax.
member.param: The parameter to check for.
member.returns: True if the parameter exists, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MapStyle.SetTemplateVariable(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Assign a value to a named template variable to the MapStyle.
member.param: The name of the template variable.
The value to assign to the template variable.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MapStyle.GetTemplateVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve the value of a named template variable.
member.param: The name of the template variable.
member.returns: The value of the template variable.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MapStyle.GetParameterValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified parameter. The parameter will be set in the Chameleon .CAM file using the PARAMETER %param = 1 syntax.
member.param: The parameter to get the value of.
member.returns: The parameter value, or 0 if no such parameter exists.

example.code: MapStyle style = MapStyle.Create("my_style_file.cam"); float p = style.GetParameterValue("my_param_name");

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MapStyle.ClearParameter(System.String)
member.summary: Clear the parameter to the Unset state.
member.param: Name of the parameter to clear.

member.summary: Get names of available properties.

example.code: // Properties are set in the Chameleon (.CAM) file as follows: PROPERTY copyright = "Telogis, Copyright __YEAR__"

member.summary: Gets a Property value by name.

member.exception: An exception will be thrown if an attempt is made to set a parameter to a negative value.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicensePack
member.summary: Represents a collection of licenses stored in a single .LIC file.
member.remarks: Each license pack can serialize to and from an XML license file. Each license within the pack is signed, but the pack itself is not. Licenses can be added or removed without affecting the validity of the pack.

member.summary: Writes the license pack to the response stream for download. The included filename is only a suggestion to the user agent.
member.param: Suggested file name.
Indicates that the file should be written directly to the response and not saved as a new file. When false the user is prompted to open or save the file on their computer.
member.remarks:
Use this method to provide license downloads on your website. You should be careful to not write any additional content to the response stream, or call Response.End() after this method.
NOTE: The response must be buffered for this method to work. In general buffering is on by default in ASP.NET applications.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon
member.summary: Latitude Longitude Pair, expressed in degrees (WGS84 World Geodetic System projection).
member.remarks:
GeoBase works with the WGS84 World Geodetic System. If your data is in a different projection you will need to reproject the points to work with them in GeoBase. For more information on WGS84 click here.
Related articles: Common Concepts, Geocoding Concept, Map Control Tutorial, Creating a Route, Routing with Traffic.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon.FromDegMinDec(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char)
member.summary: Converts to degrees a co-ordinate specified in Degrees, Minutes and Degree Decimal Minutes. This positioning format is often used by GPS devices.
member.remarks: Degree Decimal Minutes (DDM) is a standard used by some governments and GPS manufacturers. Instead of specifying Degrees (D), Minutes (M) and Seconds (S) a position may be expressed as D, M, DDM where DDM is a 4-digit decimal fraction of a minute.
member.param: Degrees.

Minutes.
Valid range: 0-59

Fractions of a minute (also known as 'degree decimal minutes').
Valid range: 0-9999
North, South, East or West. Valid characters: {'N', 'S', 'E', 'W'}

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon.FromParts(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Char)
member.summary: Create a LatLon from position parameters.
member.param: Degrees latitude.
Latitude minutes.
Latitude degree decimal minutes.
Latitude compass direction. One of: 'N', 'S'.
Degrees longitude.
Longitude minutes.
Longitude degree decimal minutes.
Longitude compass direction. One of: 'E' 'W'.
member.remarks: Degree Decimal Minutes (DDM) is a standard used by some governments and GPS manufacturers. Instead of specifying Degrees (D), Minutes (M) and Seconds (S) a position may be expressed as D, M, DDM where DDM is a 4-digit decimal fraction of a minute.
member.returns: A new LatLon.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon.DistanceTo(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Measure distance between this and another LatLon (using ).
member.param: Destination LatLon.
Unit that measurement is returned in.
member.returns: Distance in requested units.
member.remarks: The value returned represents the distance over the face of a sphere rather than the straight line distance. See for more information.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon.PythagoreanDistanceTo(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Measure approximate distance between this and another LatLon (using a Pythagorean approximation). See remarks for comments on the accuracy of this method.
member.remarks: The Pythagorean distance assumes that the world is flat between the two points. This assumption is safe when the points are near each other. If the points are a significant distance apart the straight line between the Polygon and the point will pass through the interior of the world. To calculate the true shortest distance consider using the DistanceTo method. The DistanceTo method calculates the distance using a great circle which traces an arc over the surface of the earth.
member.param: Destination LatLon.
Unit that measurement is returned in.
member.returns: Distance in requested units.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Check for equality with another LatLon by checking if they occupy the same co-ordinates.
member.param: The LatLon to compare with.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon.IsWithin(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Check whether this LatLon lies within a box defined by the minimum and maximum LatLon's. See remarks.
member.param: Represents the minimum latitude & longitude.
Represents the maximum latitude & longitude.
member.returns: true if this LatLon lies within the area given, false if not.
member.remarks: The minimum and maximum LatLons can be thought of as representing the opposite corners of a box. Thus the method tests whether this LatLon lies within (or on the edge of) said box. Should the parameters have the same latitude of longitude then the method returns true if this LatLon lies on a line drawn between the two parameters.

member.remarks: This abstract class implements the functionality required to service JSON requests. Inheriting classes need only define arbitrary methods and mark them with JsonRpcMethodAttribute, and this base class will take care of exposing them and routing requests to them.

member.summary: Gets an array of s, of the specified , that lie underneath the given .

remarks.para:
This method also matches s that pass through bbox and continue outside its area.
Further, Streets with BoundingBoxes that intersect bbox will also be returned by this method, thus it is possible that streets will be returned that appear to lie outside rect.
The maximum number of results that can be returned is limited, depending on the application's platform. For desktop applications, this value is 262144; for mobile applications, the limit is 4096.

member.param: The representing the area to be queried.
The that should be matched.
member.returns: An array of s matching the specified type.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.Server.JSONDataQuery.FindNearestPolygons(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets an array of objects from a given table that are near the given location. Polygons are used to represent features such as lakes, golf courses, parking lots and forests.

remarks.para: See for a list of predefined tables.

member.para: Use this method with caution as it only returns one result, even if multiple polygons are within the search location. It is recommended that FindNearestPolygons is used instead, which returns an array of polygons from within the search location.
member.param: Polygon objects nearest to this location will be returned.
The name of the table to query. See
Level used to simplify results, given as meters per pixel
member.returns: The nearest s. There may be more than one if the query point touches one or more Polygon objects. An empty array is returned if there are no results.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.Server.JSONDataQuery.QueryPolygons(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of s that lie underneath the given .
member.param: The representing the area to be queried.
The name of the polygon table to query
member.returns: An array of s matching the specified type.

remarks.para:
This method matches s that pass through rect and continue outside its area.
Further, Polygons with BoundingBoxes that intersect rect will also be returned by this method, thus it is possible that streets will be returned that appear to lie outside rect.
Map features are stored in tables, named according to type. Developers with custom data should avoid using the table names in the list below.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.Server.JSONDataQuery.QueryPolygonsAtPoint(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of objects that encapsulate the given . This method can be used to find polygons (such as golf courses, parks, airports, political/geographical entities and bodies of water) at a given location. See example.
member.param: A location to query.
The name of the polygon table to query (this specifies the to return).
member.returns: An array of s matching the specified type.

remarks.para: Map features are stored in tables, named according to type. Developers with custom data should avoid using the table names in the list below.

example.para: The above code snippet produces the following output:

column.row:
There is 1 golf course at the location 33.919432,-118.311809
There are a total of 3 polygons at the location 33.919432,-118.311809
1) Chester L Washington Golf Course
2) Los Angeles
3) California

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.ILinkTrafficSource
member.summary: Implemented to resolve a given LinkId and DateTime to a TrafficInfo.

remarks.para: The ILinkTrafficSource interface is implemented to resolve a given LinkId and DateTime to a TrafficInfo. A Traffic object will have one or more traffic sources which will be implemented with the ILinkTrafficSource interface.

Additional traffic data sources can be added with the ILinkTrafficSource interface. The interface exposes the GetTrafficInfo method, and the property. To implement this interface, code must be provided for both GetTrafficInfo, and CreatedTime.
CreatedTime - gets the DateTime for when the traffic data was created.
GetTrafficInfo - this method returns the for the given LinkId at the specified DateTime.

member.param: The LinkId to resolve.
The direction with respect to the given linkId (from reference, for example).
The DateTime to get the for. This will be UTC.
member.returns: The TrafficInfo for the given LinkId at the specified DateTime.

member.summary: Implemented by derived classes to resolve a given LinkId and DateTime to a TrafficInfo.
member.param: The LinkId to resolve.
The direction with respect to the given linkId (from reference, for example).
The DateTime to get the for. This will be UTC.
The timezone this LinkId exists in. This can be used to convert the UTC time passed in to the local time for the LinkId
member.returns: The TrafficInfo for the given LinkId at the specified DateTime.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.IBatchTrafficSource
member.summary: An IBatchTrafficSource provides bulk querying of traffic data.

remarks.para:
The IBatchTrafficSource interface is implemented to provide bulk querying of traffic data.
IBatchTrafficSource provides a function GetTraffic which may be called to fetch traffic information for one or more links (specified as an ITrafficRequest).
The ITrafficRequest interface provides access to one or more ITrafficItem objects, each containing infomation for a single link. ITrafficItem.SetSpeed should be used to set the speed of each ITrafficItem as appropriate.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle
member.summary: Represents a driver and vehicle combination that is available to service a route.
member.remarks: A vehicle can be configured to possess certain skills, allowing for vehicles to be assigned to jobs that match their skill set. A vehicle also has costs associated with it, such as the travelled. This data could be used to optimise vehicle selection.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.PullOutCost
member.summary: An initial start up cost, such as the cost to pull out of the garage.
member.remarks: This value allows the customer to calculate the initial cost of beginning a route. For example the value could represent a dollar figure such as the cost of rostering a driver who has a contracted 4 hour minimum shift.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.CostPerMile
member.summary: How much it costs for this vehicle to travel one mile, excluding hourly costs.
member.remarks: How much it costs for this vehicle to travel one mile, excluding any hourly costs. Typical costs would be gas, depreciation, service costs (tyre wear) etc...

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.CostPerHour
member.summary: Cost of the driver / technician per hour. It is assumed that this cost runs the whole time the vehicle is out.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.MaxMinutes
member.summary: Max minutes worked per day before overtime.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.OverTimeCost
member.summary: Excess cost incurred if the vehicle runs over its alloted time.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.Capacity
member.summary: Carrying capacity of this vehicle in undefined units.
member.remarks: No units are defined for this value. The capacity could represent the number of kilograms, cubic metres, or boxes of jellyfish the vehicle is capable of carrying. The unit that this value represents is to be decided by the implementor.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.Skills
member.summary: The skills provided by this vehicle / driver combination.
member.remarks: The term 'skills' represents the special capabilites of this vehicle and driver. Examples include a vehicle with a cargo hoist, or a driver certified to transport chemicals. Skills are represented as a bit map.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.LunchLengthMinMinutes
member.summary: How long a lunch break should be in minutes.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.MaxMinutesBeforeLunch
member.summary: How many minutes must be worked before a lunch break may be taken.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.BreakMinutes
member.summary: The length of non-lunch breaks in minutes.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Vehicle.MaxMinutesWithoutBreak
member.summary: The maximum number of minutes that can be worked without a break.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionsFactory
member.summary: A DirectionsFactory is used to generate from an array of s, which would have, typically, been created outside of GeoBase. This is useful for when third party routing engines are employed.

remarks.para: The following outlines the workflow for creating from a pre-calculated array of s.

list.item: Create a DirectionsFactory with your array of s
Call AddMovement() for each movement that you want to add to the directions

remarks.para: When calling AddMovement(), the first entry must be of MovementType , and the final call must be of MovementType .

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionsFactory.prevMovement
member.summary: The Intersection at the start of the previous movement, necessary for calculating distance between movements, as prevDesc will not be at the previous movement if there are joining links inbetween.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionsFactory.prevStartIndex
member.summary: Used for verifying that the current turn does not lie within the previously added turn, if it does an exception is thrown.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionsFactory.prevOutboundEnd
member.summary: Stores the index into the Points array of the last point in the outlink of the previous movement's IntersectionDescription. This is necessary to ensure that we dont reuse points.

member.summary: Create a DirectionsFactory using an array of s describing points along a pre-calculated route.
member.param: An array of LatLons describing points along a pre-calculated route.

member.summary: Use to add departure, turns and arrival points to the directions.
member.param: The index to the LatLon array for the start point of the movement

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.Directions.Violations
member.summary: Contains a list of all constraint violations in the directions.
member.remarks: Constraints are restrictions based on the property as well as restrictions set using the properties of the routing strategy such as , and . Constraints are not "hard" restrictions, but rather, are implemented by imposing a prohibitive cost to violation of a constraint. This means that the generated directions can include violations when there are no better routing alternatives available. The Violations property lists the links where constraint violations have occurred.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionLink.GetStreetLink
member.summary: Returns a reference to the that this direction link travels over. The street link can be used to obtain information such as the the time zone where the street lies and the post codes for the street. Note that the street link may cover more distance than the direction link. You can compare the FirstPoint and LastPoint properties of the street link to the same-named properties of the direction link to determine whether they represent the same portion of a street.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionLink.Name

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionLink.LastPoint
member.summary: The last point in the direction link. This is the same as the first point of the next direction link in the linked list.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Exceptions.DuplicateRouteStopException
member.summary: Thrown when a duplicate RouteStop object is added to a route. See remarks.

remarks.para: Consider the route with three stops: a start, and two stops (one of which is visited twice). Suppose the route is traveled as follows:

To create this route one cannot simply add [FirstStop] to the route twice (due to the way stops are stored internally). Instead, one should create another RouteStop (with the same location as [FirstStop]) and add it to the route after [SecondStop].
See .

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.DataSources.SimpleFeature
member.summary: A simple implementation of IPointFeature. A SimpleFeature has a Location, Type and Metadata associated with it. When a cluster is summarized, SimpleFeatures with the same Type are grouped together. For example, if a SimpleFeature represents a vehicle then the Type might represent the vehicle's status: Moving, Idle, Parked, and so on.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LatLonSelection
member.summary: Selects a link for editing based on its location. A heading can also be specified.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LatLonSelection.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Creates a LatLonSelection that will select the link at the supplied location. If the link permits travel in both directions then the edit will be applied to both directions. Locations should be chosen such that there is only one link at that location, to prevent ambiguities. For example, it is recommended to avoid specifying a location that is near an intersection between two or more links.
member.param: The location of the edit.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.LinkEdit.LatLonSelection.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Creates a LatLonSelection that will select the link at the supplied location with the specified heading. If the link permits travel in both directions then the edit will be applied to just one direction if it is within 20 degrees of the supplied heading. Locations should be chosen such that there is only one link at that location, to prevent ambiguities. For example, it is recommended to avoid specifying a location that is near an intersection between two or more links.
member.param: The location of the edit.
The heading of the link, in degrees.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.IMapMouseHandler
member.summary: Implement to allow an item on the map to respond to mouse clicks.
member.remarks:
IMapMouseHandler should be implemented by any object that will be displayed on an and wants to be able to respond to mouse events. IMapMouseHandler handles mouse events through the but also defines a further method called . This method is used to determine whether the implementing object lies underneath a mouse click at given x & y coordinates.
Related articles: Renderers Tutorial, Mouse Events.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.IMapMouseHandler.HitTest(System.Int32,System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.IMap)

member.param: x coordinate (pixels)
y coordinate (pixels)
The upon which the click occurred.
member.returns: The item (if the click occurred on the item). Otherwise null
member.remarks:
This method is used to determine whether an object lies underneath the co-ordinates at which the mouse was clicked. Objects that render themselves over the IMap (see ) and react to mouse input should use HitTest to check if they have been clicked on.
Related articles: Renderers Tutorial, Mouse Events.
