member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox
member.summary: Represents a rectangular area, defined by two corners: top-left and bottom-right. Used for specifying map sizes and determining feature limits.

remarks.para: A general purpose object used to represent a rectangular area. It has methods to allow resizing and to determine whether a given point lies within the box area. Some of the uses for Bounding Boxes are: zooming, or hit-testing a given area.
If adjusting points manually, please refer to remarks on P1 for important usage information.
Related articles: Data Query Concept, Avoiding a Given Area.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.HemisphereTelogians
member.summary: The number of telogians in a hemisphere.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.P1
member.summary: Represents the Min point (bottom-left corner).

remarks.para:
If you change this value by hand, you should call afterwards. However, note the following:
The method sets the bottom left-hand point to be the point that lies furthest west. Similarly, sets the top right-hand point as the point that lies furthest east.

If the bounding box is intersected by the prime meridian (the zero line of longitude through Greenwich) then there are two possibilities for the bounding box. The first is a comparatively small box, with two corners each lying either side of the meridian. The second possibility is a large rectangle that wraps around the earth, but does not cross the meridian. The solution to this ambiguity is to check if the meridian is visible on the user's map and carefully select the corners from which the desired bounding box is constructed. This is the developer's responsibility. It should be noted that this consideration is only of real concern when mapping in Western Europe, North Africa and the poles.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.P2
member.summary: Represents the Max point (top-right corner).
member.remarks: If you change this value by hand, you should call afterwards.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.m_allowCrossAntimeridian
member.summary: Whether the BoundingBox is allowed to straddle the antimeridian (the meridian at +/- 180 degrees).

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.#ctor
member.summary: Create a BoundingBox with no boundaries set.

remarks.para: If the parameter-less constructor is used the bottom-left and top-right corner points will need to be set manually and called to ensure that P1 is the bottom-left corner and that P2 is the top-right corner.
To adjust the points of a BoundingBox, consider using the and methods and the and properties.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Create a BoundingBox that contains the given BoundingBox.
member.remarks: This constructor effectively creates a BoundingBox that is a duplicate of the given BoundingBox.
member.param: The BoundingBox that this new BoundingBox should contain.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon[])
member.summary: Constructs a new bounding box around the specified points.
member.param: An array of points to be added to the bounding box.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Normalize
member.summary: Normalize the box. Should be called after manual changes to or .
member.remarks: This method should be called after manual changes to P1 or P2 because P1 must represent the bottom-left corner, and P2 must represent the top-right corner. Manual changes to P1 or P2 could result in a cross over situation (P2 is top-left and P1 bottom-right). This method ensures that P1 and P2 do not violate the positioning rule.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Inflate(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Makes each side of the box bigger or smaller by the given number of degrees.
member.param: The number of degrees by which the width should change. The sign of this parameter determines whether the box shrinks or grows. A positive degrees value causes the box to inflate, a negative value causes the box to deflate.

The number of degrees by which the height should change. The sign of this parameter determines whether the box shrinks or grows. A positive degrees value causes the box to inflate, a negative value causes the box to deflate.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Inflate(System.Double)
member.summary: Make each side of the box bigger or smaller by the given number of degrees.
member.param: The number of degrees by which the size should change. The sign of this parameter determines whether the box shrinks or grows. A positive degrees value causes the box to inflate, a negative value causes the box to deflate.
member.remarks: The box will grow or shrink on all sides by the number of degrees specified. If you have a box where .x = 10, .x = 15 and you specify 5 degrees then you get P1.x = 5 and P2.x = 20 (both sides have moved outwards by 5 degrees).

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.InflateBy(System.Double)
member.summary: Multiply the box dimensions by the given amount.
member.param: Size to inflate the box by. This is specified as an amount relative to the current box size. For example, an amount of 1 would keep the edges of the box the same size, while an amount of 2 would double the size of each edge of the box.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Add(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Inflate the box to contain the given point.
member.remarks: By calling this method repeatedly a BoundingBox may be created which contains all the given points. If is null (possibly because the default constructor was used) the first call to this method will set both P1 and to the same value, resulting in a BoundingBox with no area. If AddPoint is called again with the desired P2 value then the BoundingBox will expand.
member.param: A point that the box will inflate to contain.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Add(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Inflate the Bounding Box to include this box.
member.remarks: This method is a convenience method that calls twice, once for and again for .
member.param: A BoundingBox which this box will inflate to contain.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Contains(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Test if a given point lies within this bounding box. Points on the edge of the bounding box are considered to be outside.
member.param: A point
member.returns: True if the point lies within this Bounding Box, otherwise false. Will return false if the point lies on the edge of the bounding box.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Intersects(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Test whether this BoundingBox intersects with the specified Bounding Box.
member.param: The BoundingBox to test against.
member.returns: True if the boxes intersect, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Contains(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Tests to see if this BoundingBox fully contains another bounding box.
member.param: The BoundingBox to check
member.returns: True if this Box fully contains the other, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.Clone

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox.AllowCrossAntimeridian
member.summary: Whether the BoundingBox is allowed to straddle the antimeridian (the meridian at +/- 180 degrees). The default is true.

remarks.para: If set to true then the BoundingBox will never cover more than 180 degrees of longitude. In certain situations, the BoundingBox will achieve this by setting its left-hand edge to have a longitude larger than its right-hand edge, in which case the BoundingBox straddles the antimeridian (the meridian at +/- 180 degrees).

For example, if set to true and the following points are added to the BoundingBox: (51, 171) and (72, -130), then the BoundingBox will have P1=(51, 171) and P2=(72, -130), meaning it will approximately cover Alaska USA. However, if this property is set to false, then the BoundingBox will have P1=(51,-130) and P2=(72,171), meaning it will cover a narrow strip around the world from western Canada to eastern Russia.
This value may only be changed when the bounding box covers zero area (ie P1 == P2).

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone
member.summary:
A TimeZone may be used to convert from UTC to local (street) time. You should not construct a TimeZone object manually. Instead, use the
method, and retrieve a TimeZone object from the TimeZone property of the method's return value.
member.remarks: TimeZone objects are structs so cannot take a null value. Typically, Telogis GeoBase will allow access to TimeZone objects through nullable properties. Be sure to test HasValue (as in the code example below) to determine if timezone information is avaiable for the given street.

example.para:
Sample output:
Local time is 7/22/2010 1:51:30 PM UTC is 7/22/2010 1:51:30 AM Street time is 7/21/2010 6:51:30 PM

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.gmtOffset

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.hasDst

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.startDay
member.summary: The day that DST starts. If startType is DayOfWeek then this is a day of the week (1-7), otherwise this is a day of the month (1-31).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.startWeek
member.summary: The week of the month that DST starts. Valid range is 1-6; 6 is a special case representing the last week of the month. Only applicable if startType is DayOfMonth.

member.summary: The month that DST starts. Valid range is 1-12.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.startTime
member.summary: The time of day that DST starts. In half-hours so, for example, the value 4 indicates 2am.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.startType

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.endTime

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.endType
member.summary: Indicates whether the day on which DST ends is given by a set date in a set month, or by a set day in a set week in a set month.

member.summary: Gets the way in which the start of daylight savings is implemented for this timezone.
member.remarks: Daylight savings can either start on a specified day of a specified month (such as the first of March), or on a specified day of a specified week of a specified month (such as the first Sunday in March). Returns null if this timezone does not have daylight savings.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.DSTEndDayType
member.summary: Gets the way in which the end of daylight savings is implemented for this timezone.
member.remarks: Daylight savings can either end on a specified day of a specified month (such as the first of September), or on a specified day of a specified week of a specified month (such as the first Sunday in September). Returns null if this timezone does not have daylight savings. Use to check if this timezone has daylight savings.

member.summary: Gets the day of the month in which daylight savings starts for this timezone.

member.summary: Gets the day of the month in which daylight savings ends for this timezone.
member.remarks: Valid range is 1 to 31. 0 will be returned if this timezone does not have daylight savings or daylight savings ends on a week of a month. Use to check if this timezone has daylight savings. Use to check how daylight saving is implemented for this timezone.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.TimeZone.DSTStartWeekOfMonth
member.summary: Gets the week of the month in which daylight savings starts for this timezone.

remarks.para: Valid range is 0-6, where 0 and 6 are special cases.
A value between 1 and 5 is returned to represent the number of the week in the month, where 1 is the first week, 2 is the second week, etc.
0 will be returned if this timezone does not have daylight savings, or daylight savings starts on a day of a month.
6 will be returned to represent the last week of the month.
Use to check if this timezone has daylight savings. Use to check how daylight saving is implemented for this timezone.

0 will be returned if this timezone does not have daylight savings, or daylight savings starts on a day of a month.
6 will be returned to represent the last week of the month.
Use to check if this timezone has daylight savings. Use to check how daylight saving is implemented for this timezone.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Clustering.LocalClusterLayer
member.summary: LocalClusterLayer is responsible for the fetching, caching, and indexing of clusters and associated features. Feature infomation is fetched on another thread and is called when new features are available.

remarks.para: LocalClusterLayer is intended to act as a single, global object that persists for the lifetime of your application. It fetches point data automatically, based on the refresh rate of the feature data source. This data is cached to improve performance.Applications that use a cluster layer locally to generate clusters, but that do not keep a reference to the cluster layer once the clusters are first generated should use instead.
All calls to and occur on a separate thread from the thread used to call .

member.name: M:Internal.ConfigSettings.GetSettings(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a collection of string settings for a given key in the given section.
member.param: Name of the setting to return.
Name of the section where the value can be found. May be null. Use forward slashes to distinguish sub sections.
member.returns: Returns a collection of values if found, otherwise null.
member.remarks: The design of this method allows developers to define configuration settings in custom configuration sections, or directly in the appSettings section. When setting values in the appSettings section, key names are prefixed with the prefix and section name eliminate possible naming collisions. If a value is set in the appSettings section and a custom section, both values are returned, with the custom settings first in the array.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.AddressCustomFormControl
member.summary: Implements a US address form for the . .
member.remarks:
The AddressCustomFormControl adds the following fields to the registration form
Name Use
country The users's country. The value is one of the US Postal service's two letter country indentification codes.
streetAddress The users's street address.
city The users's city.
state The users's city or province. When country is US, then contains one of the US Postal service's two letter state abbreviations.
zipcode The users's zip or postal code.
phone The users's phone number.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.ICustomFormControl
member.summary: Controls that implement the ICustomFormControl can be included in the Additional Info section of the , and perhaps other dynamic forms in the future.
member.remarks: Generally a developer will want to use a as the base class for a custom register contact control. The control will be added to a scrolling panel so size is not an issue.

member.param: Name of the field to validate.
member.returns: Returns true if the fields are value, otherwise false.

member.param: A collection of name/value pairs to add the field values to.

member.summary:
Defines an binding. Values can be lists, dictionarys, or strings.
For example:
#define $(traffic) [{class:1, limit:0.31, color:(222, 0, 0)}, {class:2, limit:0.62, color:(239, 102, 0)}, {class:3, limit:0.92, color:(255, 204, 0)}, {class:4, color:( 51, 177, 0)}] #end

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Compiler.Preprocessor.ASTForeach
member.summary:
Repeats a block for each element within a given list.
For example:
#foreach $(traffic) => $(cat) render [ALL:$(cat.class)],pen<$(cat.color),2> #end

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Compiler.Preprocessor.ASTLine
member.summary:

render [ALL:$(cat.class)],pen<$(cat.color),2>

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.IMap
member.summary: Country / Engine independent map interface with support for zooming.
member.remarks:
The interface provides support for user code to render additional features on maps. An example is the . See the interface for more details.
Related articles: How Renderers Work, Using Multiple Renderers.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.IMap.GetMap
member.summary: Generate a map synchronously using current Center, Size and Zoom.
member.returns: System.Drawing.Image for further drawing.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.IMap.GetMap(System.Boolean,Telogis.GeoBase.MapProgress,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Generate a map using current Center, Size and Zoom.
member.remarks:
If isAsync is true, and parts of the map cannot be drawn immediately (for example, some of the required tiles are not present in the cache), the map is still returned immediately, with those parts left blank, or marked with 'loading' as appropriate. In contrast, GetMap() with isAsync false will not return until it's drawn the whole map, even if that requires waiting for tiles.
If isAsync is true, and the map can be rendered immediately anyway, done will be true on return, and the progressDelegate will not be called. Otherwise, done will be false, and progressDelegate will be called every time more of the map is available, until either it is completed (and the progressDelegate has been called with isComplete set to true) or CancelAsync() has been called.
member.param: If true, fetch and draw the map asynchronously.
If isAsync is true, this parameter specifies a delegate to be called when more of the map is available for rendering.
Set to true if the map was rendered completely, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.IMap.CancelAsync
member.summary: Cancels the asynchronous map fetch underway, if any.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.IMap.MinZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the Minimum zoom level for this map.
member.remarks: The zoom height is calculated from the distance between the left and right edges of the visible map (measured in degrees), multiplied by 50: zoom = distance * 50. The zoom must be no less than 0.001 and must be no greater than 18000 (as the earth has 360 degrees in circumference).

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.IMap.MaxZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum zoom level for this map.
member.remarks: The zoom height is calculated from the distance between the left and right edges of the visible map (measured in degrees), multiplied by 50: zoom = distance * 50. The zoom must be no less than 0.001 and must be no greater than 18000 (as the earth has 360 degrees in circumference).

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.AbstractMap.Progressive
member.summary: Whether the map should be drawn in progressive mode, a mode designed for a MapCtrl that is being used in a navigation context - where the bounding box of the map does not change a lot from one rendering to the next.
member.remarks: In non-progressive mode, each time the map is rendered the polygons, lines, points and streets are queried afresh from the data file. In progressive mode, polygons and streets are only queried from the data file on every alternate rendering. On renderings when they are not queried, the only features that are drawn are those that were drawn the previous time the map was rendered. This causes a performance improvement.

member.summary: Implemented by derived classes to get and set the zoom height of the map.

remarks.para: The zoom height is calculated from the distance between the left and right edges of the visible map (distance, measured in degrees) multiplied by 50:
The zoom must be no less than 0.001 and must be no greater than 18000 (as the earth has 360 degrees in circumference).
Note that will affect the and values.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.LocalMap.CenterPixelOffset
member.summary: Used to line up tiles. Sets an offset , in pixels, for the center of this Map tile, relative to the point of the center Map tile.

remarks.para: CenterPixelOffset allows you to treat the Map object conceptually as an infinitely large map. The map is centered around the point. returns a portion of the infinite map, Width wide and Height high. By setting CenterPixelOffset the portion of the underlying map that is rendered by can be controlled. This allows you to request several smaller maps from the same object and then reconstruct a larger map from these tiles. This is especially useful in web applications.

example.para: The diagram below shows the underlying object. Overlayed are four maps that would be generated by setting the Width and Height to 100 each, then adjusting the for each. Map 1 has the set to (0,0), so it renders a map exactly as normal, centered around it's . Map 2 has the same as Map 1 but since it has set to (-100,0) it renders an area to the left of Map 1.
Similarly, Map 4 is positioned below Map 1 as it has the same but a of (0,100) - no sideways shift, but 100 pixels lower.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.LocalMap.Projected

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.LocalMap.ProjectionCentre
member.summary: Represents the center of the map projection. By default this value is null and the center is always the center of the visible map area.
member.remarks: By setting ProjectionCentre one is able to lock the center of the map projection. Rather than updating the projection to center on the center of the displayed map, the center will remain fixed as the map is panned around. As the map is panned further away from the center the display will appear more skewed, however the constant center allows sections of map to be stitched together. This is only possible when the center is locked, as otherwise the automatically reprojected map segments will not match up.

remarks.para: Related articles: Routing with ADAS Data.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Adas.AdasQuery.QueryLink(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Retrieve ADAS information for a given street link. The street link is specified by linkId.

ul.li: ADAS information currently only includes road slope information. Other ADAS information (such as radius of curvature for corners) is expected to become available in the future.
Often only major roads have ADAS information. Where ADAS information is not available for a given street link a zero-length array will be returned.
Typically the array returned will only have one element. However, in the case that overlapping (or multiple) sets of ADAS data are available this array may contain multiple elements.

member.param: ID of the street link.
member.returns: An array of for the given street link.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.VehicleSpec
member.summary: Used to describe a vehicle's specifications.
member.remarks:
Each Route, Navigator and NavigationManager has a . When optimizing a route, or obtaining driving directions the Route, Navigator or NavigationManager will consider the attributes specified in its VehicleSpec property to ensure that the route is safe.
Use the method to configure the load that the vehicle is carrying. This load may include HAZMAT designations. See for possible designations.
You may use the to convert between distance units.
Note that it may be necessary to call ForceRecalculate if a vehicle's specifications are changed after a route has been calculated.
Related articles: Using Truck Attributes.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.DisplayNameMode
member.summary: DisplayNameMode is used to control whether NavigationEvents include all names for the TargetStreet, or just the primary name. The latter mode may be useful when screen space is limited.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.DisplayNameMode.FullName
member.summary: When Full Name is used, NavigationEvents return all given names for a particular TargetStreet regardless of how many names a street has.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.DisplayNameMode.PrimaryName
member.summary: When Primary Name is used, NavigationEvents only return the first name given to a TargetStreet. Therefore if a street has one or more alternative names they will be ignored.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator
member.summary: Guides the user along a route using GPS updates.
member.remarks:
Generally the Navigator is constructed, any desired notifications added and then a timer (or separate thread) instated to call the AddPoint method at regular intervals. The AddPoint method updates the current location of the Navigator.
Related articles: Navigation Tutorial, Using a Navigator, Using an XmlWaveAnnouncer, Using a LabelBox, Using a TurnBox, Implementing an IGps Member, Using Languages and Cultures.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.IGps)
member.summary: Create a new Navigator with the specified GPS unit. The Navigator will print strings in US English.
member.remarks:
This constuctor remains for back-compatibility with code written against GeoBase 3.0.5 or earlier. Code written against GeoBase 3.0.7 or later should use the other constructors, which have improved support for internationalization. This constructor will be deprecated in the next major GeoBase release.
Related articles: Implementing an IGps Member.

Whether to perform all language-based operations in debug mode.
member.remarks: When in debug mode, the Navigator will raise s when errors are found in the language configuration file. When errors are found in the language configuration file and the Navigator is not in debug mode it will proceed on a best effort basis.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator.RouteCalculator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the implementation of IRouteCalculator - the method this Navigator uses for calculating the route.
Note: The Navigator will dispose of the IRouteCalculator when it is no longer required. A caller should not maintain a reference to a Navigator's RouteCalculator after setting it.

remarks.para: Setting this value to null will also set the Navigator's Destination to null, and revert the Navigator's VehicleSpec to the default. To route with the default route calculator, set this value to null, optionally set your VehicleSpec, THEN set your Destination.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator.MessagesBundle
member.summary: The MessagesBundle used by this Navigator to generate strings.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator.Directions
member.summary: Gets the for this navigator to the defined .

remarks.para: The returned will be a single instruction only, that is, one instruction describing the next movement along the route. For a complete list of instructions describing a route, consider the method in the namespace.
The must have a of to provide sufficient precision to allow this navigator to calculate directions.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.ShapeUI.State.PolygonEditState.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,Telogis.GeoBase.RenderContext)
member.summary:
Renders all relevant shapes to the render context in the following order:
- All shapes apart from the entity being editing
- The selected entity
- The selected entity's edges (if highlighted)
- The selected entity's vertices (if highlighted)
- The selected entity's moving vertex (if a vertex is being moved).
member.param: The drawing surface
Control for the placement of objects

member.summary: Calculate the shortest distance from the given point to this GISObject.
member.remarks: This distance is calculated using an arc, as opposed to the (longer) straight-line distance. The use of an arc returns the true shortest distance, taking into account the curvature of the earth's surface.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Line
member.summary: Represents a non-street line feature, such as a railway, stream or custom line data.
member.remarks:
When this object represents a built-in GeoBase line, flags tell GeoBase whether this line is a railway, river etc.
Flags are assigned automatically when data is loaded from the database. For custom data, the flags and name fields are ignored and the inherited column access methods from should be used to access feature attributes.
Related articles: Data Query Concept.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Line.Flags
member.summary: The flag indicates the type of line feature being represented.
member.remarks:
Possible flag values are:
Flag valueRepresents
0 A railway tunnel.
1 A railway.
2 A river.
3 A canal.
4 A county line.
5 A state line.
6 A country line (border).

Unit that measurement is returned in.
member.returns: Distance in units.

member.summary: Create a new Polygon object.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Polygon.Flags
member.summary: The flag represents the type of polygon feature, for example a lake.
member.remarks:
Different water size types are available so that the renderer may easily determine, for a given zoom level, which water polygons are visible and should be rendered. The sizes given here are approximations of typical values.
Valid flag values are:
Flag valueRepresents
0 Oceans
1 States
2 Cities
3 Bays
4 Water
5 Buildings
6 Unused
7 Unused
8 Airports
9 Cemeteries
10 Hospitals
11 Industrial complexes
12 Military bases
13 National parks
14 State parks
15 County parks
16 Shopping centers
17 Sports complexes
18 Colleges
19 Aircraft roads (runways & taxi-ways)
20 Golf courses
21 Native American reservations
22 Countries
23 Counties
24 Islands

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Polygon.Contains(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Check whether a given point is inside this polygon. If the point is inside a hole this will return false.
member.param: The point to check.
member.returns: True if the point is inside the outer ring and outside all the inner rings, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Polygon.DistanceTo(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Gets the shortest distance from the given location to the edge of this Polygon, in the specified units. If the given location is inside this Polygon, the distance returned will be zero. See remarks for comment on the accuracy of this method.
member.param: Location
The result will be measured in these units
member.returns: Shortest distance from loc to the edge of this Polygon in units units, or zero if loc is inside the Polygon.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.IllegalRepository
member.summary: A repository that cannot be used. Any attempts to use this repository results in an InternalRepositoryException. This repository exists to police situations where a thread's current repository must be expressly set.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Internal.Mapping.AuxLayerOperationHandler
member.summary: Applies auxiliary overlays at stages during the map rendering process, and flattens the image at the end of the rendering.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Internal.Mapping.AuxLayerOperationHandler.ApplyOverlays(Telogis.GeoBase.RenderMode)
member.summary: Applies "OVERLAY LAYER" statements from the CAM file by moving the layers from source onto target with the specified alpha. For example, OVERLAY LAYER [PRELABELLING], SOURCE 1, TARGET 0, ALPHA 50 will move the first aux layer onto the base layer with an alpha of 50. The moved layer is reset to be fully transparent.
member.param: Current stage of rendering

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Internal.Mapping.AuxLayerOperationHandler.FlattenOverlays(System.Int32)
member.summary: Flattens all unrequested auxiliary layers onto the final requested layer with an alpha of 255. For example, in a local map we only ever request layer 0. So anything that was drawn on an auxiliary layer since that layer was last applied to layer 0 will get flattened.
member.param: The index of the final requested layer

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Internal.Mapping.AuxLayerOperationHandler.ApplyOverlay(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves a single layer from source to target, with the specified alpha.
member.param: Index of the source layer. 0 is base layer, 1+ are auxiliary layers.
Index of the target layer. 0 is base layer, 1+ are auxiliary layers.
Alpha to apply to the source layer as it's moved.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Settings.GeoBasePath(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up the given path in the GeoBase folder and returns an absolute path. The GeoBase folder is looked up in the registry at HKCU\Software\Telogis\GeoBase\path. If that key is not found then it is looked up at HKLM\Software\Telogis\GeoBase\path. If that key is not found either then the folder containing the GeoBase .NET DLL is used, except on Windows CE where the GeoBaseFolder path is used instead.
member.param: The subpath to look up in the GeoBase folder
member.returns: An absolute path to the search path.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.TrialLimit
member.summary: Marks a license as a trial license and limits the time they can use the product.
member.remarks:
By including a trial limit, developers can determine allow end users to try their product before purchasing. Developers can also check the IsTrial property on the license returned from LicenseManger.Validate to see if the license is a trial and alter code accordingly.
If the end date of the limit is more then 1 year from the started date, the license is not considered a timed trial.
The expiration date of the license should be long after the end date of the trial so that the GUI will still be displayed with only the buy option selected.
See Trial Versions for more information how XHEO|Licensing supports trial versions.
Trial Versions

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository
member.summary: A GeoStreamRepository uses one or more GeoStream servers to support local GeoBase services (such as routing and mapping).

remarks.para: Related articles: Using Repositories to manage data.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a new GeoStreamRepository from an array of server URL strings. See remarks and example.

remarks.para: GeoStream servers are known by the URL pointing to the server's GeoStream directory (the GeoStream directory contains 'tile.aspx'). The URL should be of the form: http://myserver/path_to_geostream_directory/
The default installation of GeoBase configures IIS with the following URL: http://myserver/GeoStream/

member.param: An array of server URL strings

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a new GeoStreamRepository, connecting to one or more servers using specified credentials. The same credentials will be used for all GeoStream servers in the servers array.

remarks.para: GeoStream servers are known by the URL pointing to the server's GeoStream directory (the GeoStream directory contains 'tile.aspx'). The URL should be of the form: http://myserver/path_to_geostream_directory/
The default installation of GeoBase configures IIS with the following URL: http://myserver/GeoStream/

member.param: GeoStream username
Password for the GeoStream user
An array of server URL strings

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a new GeoStreamRepository, connecting to one or more servers using specified credentials and a given session duration. After the session duration has passed the GeoStreamRepository will automatically reauthenticate. The same credentials will be used for all GeoStream servers in the servers array.

remarks.para: GeoStream servers are known by the URL pointing to the server's GeoStream directory (the GeoStream directory contains 'tile.aspx'). The URL should be of the form: http://myserver/path_to_geostream_directory/
The default installation of GeoBase configures IIS with the following URL: http://myserver/GeoStream/

member.param: GeoStream username
Password for the GeoStream user
Session duration, in minutes. Minimum of 1 minute (enforced by the server)
An array of server URL strings

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Net.WebProxy,System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a new GeoStreamRepository which is accessed through a proxy server, connecting to one or more servers using specified credentials and a given session duration. After the session duration has passed the GeoStreamRepository will automatically reauthenticate. The same credentials will be used for all GeoStream servers in the servers array.

remarks.para: GeoStream servers are known by the URL pointing to the server's GeoStream directory (the GeoStream directory contains 'tile.aspx'). The URL should be of the form: http://myserver/path_to_geostream_directory/
The default installation of GeoBase configures IIS with the following URL: http://myserver/GeoStream/

member.param: GeoStream username
Password for the GeoStream user
Session duration, in minutes. Minimum of 1 minute (enforced by the server)
Proxy server information, including the server address and authentication credentials
An array of server URL strings

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.#ctor(System.Net.WebProxy,System.String[])
member.summary: Construct a new GeoStreamRepository which is accesssed through a proxy server.

remarks.para: GeoStream servers are known by the URL pointing to the server's GeoStream directory (the GeoStream directory contains 'tile.aspx'). The URL should be of the form: http://myserver/path_to_geostream_directory/
The default installation of GeoBase configures IIS with the following URL: http://myserver/GeoStream/

member.param: Proxy server information, including the server address and authentication credentials
An array of server URL strings

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.HasCountry(Telogis.GeoBase.Country)
member.summary: Returns true only if the GeoStream server (represented by this GeoStreamRepository object) has data for the given .

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.UseDataSets(Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.Server.DataSet[])
member.summary: Specify the server-side datasets to be used.
member.param: The DataSets to use with this GeoStream server

remarks.para: When setting up a GeoStreamRepository, users can specify the server-side datasets that they wish to use. Datasets can be grouped according to vendor and country, and to be able to use the datasets, the user must have permission to use them. These permissions are set up on the server-side's userinfo.config file. For each <user id> the userinfo.config file lists the <AllowedDataSets> for which the user is entitled to use. Each <DataSet> has a Ref attribute which points to the DataSet groupings (<DataFolder>) in the repository.config file. Furthermore, a default dataset is listed in the <AllowedDataSets> should the user fail to specify a dataset.
For more information on the server-side configuration files, see Configuring the Server, under the GeoStream Security section.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.UseDataSets(System.String[])
member.summary: Specify the server-side datasets to be used.
member.param: The DataSets to use with this GeoStream server

remarks.para: When setting up a GeoStreamRepository, users can specify the server-side datasets that they wish to use. Datasets can be grouped according to vendor and country, and to be able to use the datasets, the user must have permission to use them. These permissions are set up on the server-side's userinfo.config file. For each <user id> the userinfo.config file lists the <AllowedDataSets> for which the user is entitled to use. Each <DataSet> has a Ref attribute which points to the DataSet groupings (<DataFolder>) in the repository.config file. Furthermore, a default dataset is listed in the <AllowedDataSets> should the user fail to specify a dataset.
For more information on the server-side configuration files, see Configuring the Server, under the GeoStream Security section.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.AuthToken
member.summary: The authentication token used by the server to validate requests.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.UseKeepAlive
member.summary: When true this GeoStreamRepository object will attempt to open persistent connections to the GeoStream server, by setting the Connection HTTP header to 'Keep-Alive'.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.Expect100Continue
member.summary: When this property is set to true this GeoStreamRepository object will wait for a 100 (Continue) header from the GeoStream server before sending a PUT or POST request body. This allows the GeoStreamRepository object to determine if the GeoStream server is willing to accept the GeoStream request. As RFC2616 says, "In some cases, it might either be inappropriate or highly inefficient for the client to send the body if the server will reject the message without looking at the body".

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.CompressJsonResponses
member.summary: When this is set to true, this GeoStreamRepository will indicate to the GeoStream server that it accepts JSON responses compressed using gzip or deflate.
member.remarks: This does not guarantee the server will reply with compressed responses, however, uncompressed responses will still be understood regardless of this setting.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository.DatasetHashCode

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.PartialCamRenderer
member.summary: Provides a means to apply partial cam files to a GeoBase map.

remarks.para: If the partial cam file is written to render custom data, that data must be in the same repository as the rest of the map data.

Anything in the map style that the cam file defines is drawn on top of the map. Thus, if the partial cam file includes instructions for rendering features that are already rendered by the default map style (or another partial cam renderer), those features will be drawn twice.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficFetcher
member.summary: The TrafficFetcher class is used to retrieve an up-to-date object based on traffic information from the 's sources.

remarks.para: The TrafficFetcher class is used to retrieve an up-to-date object based on traffic information from the 's sources. The TrafficFetcher does not automate the process of obtaining an updated , but instead, provides the method, which can be called synchronously, or asynchronously.
For synchronous mode, set blocking to true. In this mode, the object will not be returned until all the s have been updated, or the timeout time has elapsed.
For asynchronous mode, set blocking to false, and wait until the event is called, signalling that the data has been updated.
Related articles: Routing with Traffic.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficFetcher.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new TrafficFetcher

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficFetcher.GetLatestTraffic(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Synchronously, get the latest traffic data update from the list of s, based on the given date/time.
member.param: The date/time to retrieve the traffic data for.
member.returns: Returns a based on the newly retrieved traffic data.
member.remarks: Note: this is a synchronous call - the will not be returned until all traffic sources have been updated.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficFetcher.GetLatestTrafficAsync(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Asynchronously, get the latest traffic data update from the list of s, based on the given date/time.
member.param: The date/time to retrieve the traffic data for.
member.returns: Returns a . Note, that this may not be the latest at the time of calling this method, due to the nature of the asynchronous mode. When this method is called, if, for example, the traffic source data has expired, then a object will be returned with no new data, while the TrafficFetcher deals with downloading more up-to-date information.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficFetcher.GetLatestTraffic(System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Get the latest traffic data update from the list of s, based on the given date/time.
member.remarks: Fetches the latest Traffic data. If timeout is TimeSpan.Zero this function will return immediately. The TrafficUpdated event may be fired multiple times as updates are received. If timeout is not TimeSpan.Zero this function will wait until all traffic sources have been updated or the timeout expires. The TrafficUpdated event may be fired multiple times as updates are received. Use -1 Milliseconds to indicate to wait indefinately.
member.param: The date/time to retrieve the traffic data for.
The maximum time to wait (block) for the traffic sources to be updated. Set to -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely. Set to 0 to return immediately.
member.exception: Thrown if the timeout value is exceeded.
member.returns: Returns a based on the newly retrieved traffic data.

member.name: E:Telogis.GeoBase.Traffic.TrafficFetcher.TrafficUpdated
member.summary: This event handler is called when an update is received from an . It might not be called on the thread that called GetLatestTraffic, so event handler implementations need to be careful not to use synchronous calls that might deadlock. For example, if GetLatestTraffic was called from a UI thread then the event handler must use BeginInvoke to update UI elements.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.IRouteMatrix.RecalculateFull
member.summary: Clear the cached results from the matrix's times/distances/costs calculations.
member.remarks:
The RecalculateFull method clears the cached results from the matrix's times/distances/costs calculations. This is useful for when a RouteMatrix has been re-configured (for example, changes to Strategy, or VehicleSpec), and the most up to date calculation is required. It should be noted that the RecalculateFull method is automatically called when the RouteMatrix's RoutingStrategy is set, but it is not called automatically when the RoutingStrategy is simply modified. For example, when modifying the routing strategy's AllowUTurns property, RecalculateFull should be called.
Related articles: Using a RouteMatrix.

member.summary: Return the array of stops in the order of the matrix.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.IRouteMatrix.Strategy
member.summary: Sets the routing strategy. When the routing strategy is changed the existing network is recalculated rather than rebuilt. Changing the strategy on an existing RouteMatrix object is much faster than creating a new one.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.IRouteMatrix.VehicleSpec
member.summary: Applies a VehicleSpec to this RouteMatrix. When this value is changed the existing network is recalculated rather than rebuilt, and constraints are enabled automatically.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.IRouteMatrix.ObeyConstraints
member.summary: Setting this true ensures that constraints are obeyed when calculating routes.
member.remarks: Constraints are restrictions based on the property as well as restrictions set using the properties of the routing strategy such as , and . When ObeyConstraints is true, any route that violates these constraints is discarded. When ObeyConstraints is false, the constraints are ignored when generating the route matrix. Setting ObeyConstraints to true can result in a noticable performance penalty.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.IRouteMatrix.CurrentTime

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.DataQuery
member.summary: Allows spatial data to be queried directly. Example queries are to find s that pass through a given (see ) or to find the nearest feature to a given point (see ).

remarks.para: Related articles: Data Query Concept. Alchemy Data Import Tool, Predefined Query Tables.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DataQuery.QueryStreets(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox,Telogis.GeoBase.StreetType)
member.summary: Gets an array of s, of the specified , that lie underneath the given .

remarks.para:
This method also matches s that pass through bbox and continue outside its area.
Further, Streets with BoundingBoxes that intersect bbox will also be returned by this method, thus it is possible that streets will be returned that appear to lie outside rect.
The maximum number of results that can be returned is limited, depending on the application's platform. For desktop applications, this value is 262144; for mobile applications, the limit is 4096.

member.param: The representing the area to be queried.
The that should be matched.
member.returns: An array of s matching the specified type.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DataQuery.BeginQueryPoi(Telogis.GeoBase.BoundingBox,Telogis.GeoBase.PoiType[],System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous search for points of interest within a bounding box, starting from the center of the box and moving outwards.

remarks.para: An asynchronous query is performed in a spiral fashion, starting from the center of the given bounding box.

Initially, a search area, with 3km x 3km dimensions, is centered on the bounding box's center. If the bounding box is smaller than the search area, then the search area is clipped down to size. If all sides are clipped, no more queries will be performed.

If not all sides are clipped, the search starts working in a spiral. After each iteration of the algorithm, it will have queried a square area (unless it hits the bounding box), so at the beginning of each iteration the following queries are planned:

Each box (A,B,C and D) is calculated, and fed into GeoBase for querying. These boxes are clipped to the bounding box if necessary. If a box is clipped entirely (to zero width or height) then the query needn't be performed.
Once all boxes are clipping to zero width or height, the query is complete.
The thickness of the spiral boxes is controlled by T.

member.param: The within which to search
An array of PoiTypes to restrict the search to. If this is null or empty all PoiTypes are returned.
A substring to search for in POI names.
The callback to call when more results become available. This may be called multiple times.
The state of the asynchronous query.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DataQuery.EndQueryPoi(System.IAsyncResult,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Receive the next set of Poi results from an asynchronous Poi query.
member.param: Set to true if there are no more results to receive. False if more results are still to come.
member.returns: An array of objects. Any results that have been returned in a previous call to EndQueryPoi will not be included

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DataQuery.AbortQueryPoi(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends or cancels an asynchronous search for points of interest.
member.param: Must be a PoiAsyncResult
member.remarks: This call will block until the query thread finshes it current opertation. If the AsyncCallback passed to the PoiAsyncResult is executing when AbortQueryPoi is called, the calling thread will be blocked until the callback has finished.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DataQuery.AbortQueryPoiAsynchronously(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends or cancels an asynchronous search for points of interest.
member.param: Must be a PoiAsyncResult
member.remarks: This call will not wait for the query thread to finish and will return immediately. If the AsyncCallback passed to the PoiAsyncResult is executing when AbortQueryPoiAsynchronously is called, it will run until the callback is completed.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.StreetLink
member.summary: Represents a single street link. A link is typically a section of street running between two intersections.
member.remarks:
A street link may terminate between intersections if street type or the local post (zip) code changes. Thus an apparently contiguous street may be made up of multiple different street links.
Related articles: Geofences Concept, Data Query Concept.

member.returns: The hash code for this link.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.DomainLimit
member.summary: Restricts the use of a protected Type to a collection of domain names.
member.remarks:
The current request must be for the given domain name. If the IPAddress is specified then the domain must also resolve to that address.
Domain names can include wild cards in their names. You can use the standard * and ? characters for any word or character respectively. If the name is prefixed with the # character, the text following it is treated as a regular expression and is compared with the given pattern.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker
member.summary: Used to display a vehicle's location on a map.

remarks.para: The VehicleMarker object uses a Navigator object to determine the location of the vehicle. The VehicleMarker object will not redraw its position automatically. It is your responsibility to update the position of the VehicleMarker object by forcing a redraw (typically by invalidating the that the VehicleMarker object is drawn on). You may wish to do this by attaching to the event, or by using a Timer object.
A red arrow is drawn when the vehicle is on-course, this color can be changed by modifying the property. When the vehicle deviates off-course a gray arrow will be drawn instead.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.m_nav
member.summary: The Navigator object that holds the positional information for the vehicle associated with this VehicleMarker object.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator)
member.summary: Create a new VehicleMarker object, using the specified Navigator object to provide location information.

member.summary: Renders the VehicleMarker on a given graphics output with a given context. (Desktop version).
member.param: The object that can be used to draw on the map.
The information for this call.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Navigator object associated with this marker.

member.summary: The color of the circle drawn around the arrow. Blue by default.

member.summary: The style of the circle drawn around the arrow. Dashed by default.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.CircleDashPattern
member.summary: The length of the dashes and spaces, in pixels. {5, 5} by default.

example.code: // 5px dash, 10px space myVehicleMarker.CircleDashPattern = new float[] {5, 10};

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.DrawActual
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to draw the vehicle's actual or estimated position. If true the actual position is drawn. If false the estimated position is drawn.
member.remarks: By default the VehicleMarker object is drawn slightly ahead of the vehicle's current position to allow for update delays.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color (ARGB) used to draw the vehicle marker.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.OffCourseColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color (ARGB) used to draw the vehicle marker when the vehicle is either off-course or there is no GPS fix.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the vehicle marker (in pixels). Defaults to 20px.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.OffCourseThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance (in pixels) the vehicle marker is allowed to deviate before drawing the off-course marker. Defaults to 35px.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.DrawOffCourseMarker
member.summary: Whether to draw the off-course marker if the vehicle deviates from the route. If set to false then the only time the off-course marker will be displayed is if there is not a GPS fix. Defaults to true. Only valid if DrawActual is true.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.RequiredRendermodes
member.summary: Gets the RenderMode required by this VehicleMarker

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.CircleMode
member.summary: Draw an ellipse around the vehicle marker.

member.summary: Ellipse not drawn.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.VehicleMarker.CircleMode.On
member.summary: Ellipse drawn.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.LocalLazyRouteCalculator
member.summary: LocalLazyRouteCalculator calculates the directions for a route lazily so that navigation can begin before we have finished processing the directions.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.ILazyRouteCalculator.DescribeNext
member.summary: This method is called by the navigator to describe the next turn on the route. DescribeNext().
member.returns: Returns true if there are more turns to be described. The Navigator will call this repetatively for a certain period of time so that the upcoming movement will likely always be described.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.ILazyRouteCalculator.IsRouteLegal
member.summary: Called by the Navigator to check whether the current route is free from constraint violations and if not, apply a routing constraint so that the next route calculated will be different. Geobase uses the directions generator to check whether a constraint has been violated, and if so, recalculates the route.
member.returns: Returns true if the route is legal and hence does not need to be recalculated.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DrillDownGeoCoder.BeginGetStreets(System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous street search operation
member.param: The search term used to find streets
Method to call when the search is complete
The state of the asynchronous search.
member.returns: IAsyncResult allowing the caller to query the state of the search.

remarks.para: An asynchronous street search is performed using the drilldown geocoder's BeginGetStreets in conjunction with AbortGetStreets, and EndGetStreets. AbortGetStreets simply cancels an asynchronous street search operation; in the example below, it is used to cancel any previous search operation, so that we can safely start a new search.

BeginGetStreets will create a new thread and begin the search operation. When the search is complete, the callback function that is passed to BeginGetStreets is called. In the example below, the callback function (GetStreetsCallback(IAsyncResult searchResult)) calls UpdateStreetsList(), which in turn calls EndGetStreets to return the search results, once the search has completed, and populates the list box 'listBoxResults'.

example.para: This example assumes that the region levels, in the drill-down geocoder, have been set. It also assumes that we have a drilldown geocoder, called 'ddgc', and a list box to place the street search results in to, called 'listBoxResults'.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DrillDownGeoCoder.BeginGetStreets(System.String,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Internal begin get sreets
member.param: In milliseconds

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DrillDownGeoCoder.EndGetStreets(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Wait until the search has finished, and returns the search results
member.remarks:
Use in conjunction with , and BeginGetStreets.
See BeginGetStreets for more details on using the asynchronous street search methods.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DrillDownGeoCoder.AbortGetStreets(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends or cancels an asynchronous street search operation
member.remarks:
Use in conjunction with BeginGetStreets, and EndGetStreets.
See BeginGetStreets for more details on using the asynchronous street search methods.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DrillDownGeoCoder.ListSetRegions
member.summary: Returns a list of regions corresponding to each level in the country.

returns.para: An array of RegionData objects that correspond to the levels in the DrillDownGeoCoder's country.
Any element may be null. A null element indicates that a particular level has not been set to a region.

The array index is directly mapped to the region level number thus, in the U.S. ListSetRegions()[0] corresponds to the set region for the State and ListSetRegions()[1] corresponds to the set region for the County.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop
member.summary: Represents a stop on a route. Fields include the location of the stop, a description of the stop and the nearest intersection.
member.remarks:
A RouteStop holds information about a stop on a route. Such information includes a description of the stop.
Related articles: Routing Concept, Map Control Tutorial, Creating a Route, Delivery Time Windows, Routing with Traffic.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Location
member.summary: Location of the stop point, as a .

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.TimeSpentAtStop
member.summary: Time spent at the stop. Used when optimizing with Time Windows. In most cases this will be the average time. For Breaks though it may be different from the average time.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Clone
member.summary: Used to create an identical instance (clone) of a .
member.returns: A new instance, identical to this instance.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.m_Point
member.summary: The coordinates of this .

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Load
member.summary: Quantity of goods to be delivered (or collected). Not yet implemented.
member.remarks:
A flexible value which can be used by the customer to determine the quantity of goods that will be moved on or off the vehicle at this point. For example:
A van delivering boxes of chips might have a load value of -10 boxes of chips.
A truck picking up an oven might have a load value of +2 cubic meters.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.SkillsRequired
member.summary: Specific 'skills' that this stop requires. Must match a bit in the vehicle skills map. Not yet implemented.
member.remarks:
Skills represent special conditions that a given stop requires. A couple of examples:
A company that does piping repairs sends one of its vans to fix a gas pipe. The required skill is that the person attending this call have the necessary certification to perform gas pipe repairs.
A package delivery company sends one of its trucks to a site to pick up a large package. The 'skill' required is that the truck have a mechanical lifting & loading mechanism.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.IncompatibleLoads
member.summary: Array of stops whose loads should not be carried with the load for this stop. Dynamite shouldn't be with matches. Not yet implemented.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.DontLoadBefore
member.summary: Array of stops whose load must not be loaded before this stop. Not yet implemented.
member.remarks: Steel should not be loaded before eggs.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Description
member.summary: Description of the stop. See remarks.
member.remarks: When directions are generated using this RouteStop the description field (if populated) will be used in the appropriate place in the . For example, if is set to "Home Base", the directions for this stop would read something similar to: "'Home Base' is on the left 132 yards after 'Maple Avenue'"

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.DirectToNext
member.summary: Whether the unit should just go straight to the next stop in the route history. Calculated by native code, and used when calculating a route highlight.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.FullStopIndex
member.summary: Index in the FullStops array. Used when optimizing stops with windows.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.RoadIntersection
member.summary: Point where you enter or exit the street network to get to this stop.
member.remarks: RoadIntersection will generally be null, the Routing Engine will Reverse GeoCode the and use an implied intersection as the entry point to the street network.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.WindowStart
member.summary: Earliest delivery time.

remarks.para: Related articles: Delivery Time Windows.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.WindowEnd
member.summary: Latest delivery time.

remarks.para: Related articles: Delivery Time Windows.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.AverageTime
member.summary: Average time spent at this stop. For s, the average time must be greater than or equal to the minimum time.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Penalty
member.summary: Represents a penalty incurred for missing the alloted window. The penalty must be positive number.
member.remarks:
A penalty could be used by the customer to track the perfomance of vehicles with respect to the windows of time alloted for each RouteStop. For example, a vehicle might lose 10 'points' for each minute spent at a stop after the time window is up.
Related articles: Delivery Time Windows.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Tag
member.summary: For external use - set to whatever you like.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Heading
member.summary: The heading for this route stop. This value will be used to choose which street this RouteStop belongs on - GeoBase will try to route to a street that is aligned with this heading. For example, this can be used to avoid accidentally routing from a cross street. If this value is float.NaN, then this behavior will be ignored.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.TimeSincePreviousStop
member.summary: Time in seconds since the unit was at the previous stop in the route history. Used when calculating a route highlight. Set to 0 for the first stop, and 120 for all other stops where the information is unknown.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Speed
member.summary: The unit's speed, in knots, when it was at this stop in the route history. Used when calculating a route highlight.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.IgnitionOn
member.summary: Whether the unit's ignition was on when it was at this stop in the route history. Used when calculating a route highlight.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.StopNumber
member.summary: The Number of this stop. Set by the routing engine
member.remarks: To set an identifier for the stop use the Tag property.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.Start
member.summary: If true this stop is the start point for the route.
member.remarks: If there is a start the route will always optimize with the given start point at the start. Otherwise the start point that would give the best route is chosen. Similarly, a route with an end point will always optimize with that fixed end point and if an end point is not defined the 'best' (as defined by the routing engine) candidate from all stops will be chosen as the end point. Start points are (by default) colored dark green.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.End
member.summary: If true this stop is the end point for the route. See for more details.
member.remarks: End points are colored red, see for an example of how to change this color.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop.RenderBrush
member.summary: A used to color this stop.
member.remarks: The default colour for the RenderBrush is yellow for regular s and grey for s. If a RouteStop is part of a , a fixed start will be coloured green, a fixed end will be coloured red, otherwise it will use the default yellow or grey.

member.summary: Gets the RenderMode required by this RouteStop

member.summary: Gets the for this RouteStop.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Waypoint
member.summary: Represents a Waypoint on a route.

remarks.para: Related articles: Routing and Directions.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Waypoint.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Creates a Waypoint at the given location.
member.param: The at which to place the waypoint.
member.remarks:
A Waypoint is used to influence how a Route is calculated: it is used in a similar fashion to a RouteStop, but unlike RouteStops, Waypoints will not appear in Directions. In other words, if a Route comprises RouteStops and Waypoints, although the route will pass through both RouteStops and Waypoints, only the RouteStops will be disclosed in the Directions.
When added to a MapCtrl, Waypoints are rendered as circles (as opposed to squares for RouteStops), and will snap to the nearest street.
Waypoints can not be used with a RouteMatrix, Route Highlighting, or OptimizeStops.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Waypoint.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a Waypoint at the given latitude and longitude
member.param: The latitude of the Waypoint.
The longitude of theWayPoint.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Break
member.summary: Represents a Break on a route.

remarks.para: Related articles: Routing and Directions, Breaks and Time Window Optimization.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Break.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a Break at the given latitude and longitude.

example.code: // Create a new Break at lat 34, lon -118 Break br = new Break(34.0, -118.0);

member.param: The latitude to stop at.
The longitude to stop at.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Break.TimeIncludesExtraTravel
member.summary: If true, extra time taken for travel to the location of the Break is taken out of the time for the Break, up to the minimum time available. This is only used for breaks which have a specific location.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Break.StartTimeIsFixed
member.summary: For Breaks with no specific location, this property makes the time window begin and end at the WindowStart time. The Break will begin at the WindowStart time unless the penalties set for the optimization make it too costly to do so. The WindowStart property must be set to use the StartTimeIsFixed property. This property has no effect it the Break has a location.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Break.MinimumTime
member.summary: Minimum time to be spent at the Break. If the minimum time to be set exceeds the average time, the average time is increased to equal the minimum time.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.RendererList
member.summary: A Collection of Renderers which allows multiple s to draw on the same .
member.remarks:
An can only have one assigned to it at a time. To allow multiple s to draw on a single map, a should be used.
Each added to the will have its method called. These will be called in the order that the s were added to the . s can be added to the using the method.
Related articles: Map Concept, Routing Concept, Using Notifications and Events, Renderers Tutorial, Using Multiple Renderers, Render Modes in Detail.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.PushPin
member.summary: A light-weight object that can be quickly drawn on a map.

remarks.para: A push pin is a light-weight object that can be drawn on an to display information. An example of this is the which can be used to show name and address details for a given location on the map. Push pins can be made to respond to mouse clicks by implementing the interface.
You may
Related articles: Map Control Tutorial, Mouse Events.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.DirectionalPushPin
member.summary: A light-weight push pin that may be rotated to a specified before being drawn. For example, a DirectionalPushPin could be used to describe the direction and position of a truck.

remarks.para: For best results you should use an icon that is rotatable about its center (that is, the hotspot of the icon is at (width/2, height/2).
values are automatically kept within 360 degrees, but ensuring that the heading results in a visually appropriate rotation is your responsibility.

member.summary: Gets or sets the heading (in degrees) of this DirectionalPushPin.

remarks.para: The heading value represents a clockwise rotation of the Icon by x degrees before it is drawn. Care should be taken to ensure that the heading value results in a visually appropriate rendering of the icon.
Values are automatically constrained such that 0 <= x < 360.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.BalloonPushPin
member.summary: A with an informational balloon. The balloon may be hidden if required.

remarks.para: A BalloonPushPin appears as an information balloon anchored to a point on a map. The balloon can be given a name (such as "Some Company Ltd", the default is "PushPin") below which additional information can be displayed, such as a street address.
Both the balloon and its information (if any) are displayed by default. Use and to modify this behavior.
When an address is known, it is strongly recommended to use to avoid a performance hit from the Reverse Geocoding, and ensure that the correct (or desired) address is used in labelling the balloon.
Related articles: Map Concept, Drill-down Geocoder Tutorial, Map Control Tutorial, Using Multiple Renderers, Render Modes in Detail.

member.summary: Create a new push pin anchored at the given location. The informational balloon will contain information about the street address.
member.remarks: The address of the BalloonPushPin is reverse-geocoded. If the address is not required, you may avoid this slight performance penalty by setting loadAddress to false.

If true, display the address of the BalloonPushPin. If false, the address of the BalloonPushPin will not be shown.

member.remarks: The location is Reverse Geocoded to get an , from which location information is extracted and placed in the informational balloon. When an address is known, it is strongly recommended to use to avoid a performance hit from the Reverse Geocoding, and ensure that the correct (or desired) address is used in labelling the balloon.

The map co-ordinates to which the balloon will point.

remarks.para: is set to contain street and postal information.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.ActivationServer
member.summary: Implements an Activation Server as an XML WebService.
member.remarks:
You can create an Activation Server manually or by using the License Manager Setup Wizard. From the License Manager select Tools | Setup Wizard and select the Web.config file of the web application that will host the Activation Server Web Service.
To implement your activation server manually, derive from this class in your web service file and override the Activate method. This method gets a copy of the complete signed license and the machine profile hash. The returned license must then set the profile hash of the Activation limit in the license and resign the license.
You can use this server to implement a central license activation service.

member.summary: Activates a previously issued license.
member.param: Name of the assembly whos keys were used to sign the licenses. The public key is embedded in the component's assembly. The private key is stored securely on the license server's machine
The signed license as an XML string to validate.
The comparable profile hash of the from the machine the license is being activated from.
member.returns: On success returns the newly signed license, otherwise throws an exception.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.BehaviorAdapter
member.summary: Class that provides an easy way to override default MapCtrl behavior.

remarks.para: This class provides a number of events that are called when the corresponding event is fired on the MapCtrl. If no handler is defined for the event, the default behavior of the MapCtrl is observed.
It is expected that if you define a handler for key down or mouse down which calls MapCtrl's default behavior, (if defined) your key up or mouse up event will call the default behavior also.
