member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock
member.summary: This provides access to the Kernel32.dll high resolution clock API. This is motivated by the need to have higher resolution than .Net's DateTime.Now, which is apparently about 10ms. The effective resolution of HighResClock on a P4 1.4GHz is about 10us.

remarks.para: WARNING: I don't have any particularly good way of verifying the accuracy of this class. The best I've done is in the TestSelf() which is to compare the measured duration to Sleep(), which is loose. Also, I haven't tested this on any other PCs. I understand that the high performance counter may not be available on all systems.
The "ticks" in this class DO correspond to ticks in DateTime and TimeSpan, except in the Frequency property which is explicitly the high performance counter frequency.
It's relatively expensive to read this clock, compared to DateTime.Now. Although it's only about 10us on a P4 1.4GHz, it's faster to use DateTime.Now.

This does a calibration to determine function call overhead time, which is a static field. This has a static constructor which calls Calibrate(). Calibrate() temporarily boosts the calling process and thread priority to avoid being affected by other processes/threads.
The duration calculations are adjusted by the function call overhead time calculated during Calibrate(), but Now, NowTicks, etc are not.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.K32QueryPerformanceCounter(System.Int64@)
member.summary: The ticks returned by this function are not the same as .Net's ticks.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.K32QueryPerformanceFrequency(System.Int64@)
member.summary: This returns Kernel32 ticks/sec.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.perfFreq
member.summary: Frequency obtained from kernel32. This is in kernel32's ticks per second.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.overheadTicks
member.summary: The minimum duration that this class is able to measure. This is measured during Calibrate(). This represents the number of ticks it takes to make a duration measurement, and is therefore the effective resolution of this class.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.k32TicksOffset
member.summary: This stores the offset between Kernel32's ticks and .Net's DateTime's ticks, so that we can produce accurate DateTime's.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.#ctor
member.summary: Not supposed to instantiate this class.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.Calibrate
member.summary: Measure overhead for interop calls and clock resolution. The resultant values are stored in static fields. The resultant clock frequency and function call overhead measurement are used in ticks to ms conversion and duration calculations, respectively.

remarks.para: This is called from the static constructor, so you typically won't benefit from calling it, unless during construction there were other very high priority things going on that affected the timing of the statements in this method.
This temporarily boosts this process and thread priority to avoid being affected by other processes/threads, so you definitely don't want to call this a lot.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.TicksToMs(System.Int64)
member.summary: Convert ticks to milliseconds. (A tick is 100 nanoseconds.)
member.remarks: No adjustment is made to this due to OverheadTicks.
member.param: The tick count.
member.returns: float - the number of milliseconds.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.CalcTimeSpan(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Calculate the duration as a TimeSpan.
member.remarks: This subtracts OverheadTicks from the measured ticks to compensate for overhead.
member.param: The starting tick count.
The stopTicks tick count.
member.returns: A new TimeSpan.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.CalcTimeSpan(System.Int64)
member.summary: Calculate the duration (to NowTicks) as a TimeSpan.
member.remarks: This subtracts OverheadTicks from the measured ticks to compensate for overhead.
member.param: The starting tick count.
member.returns: A new TimeSpan.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.CalcTimeSpan(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Calculate the duration (to NowTicks) as a TimeSpan.
member.remarks: This subtracts OverheadTicks from the measured ticks to compensate for overhead.
member.param: The starting DateTime.
member.returns: A new TimeSpan.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.CalcTimeSpan(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Calculate the duration (to NowTicks) as a TimeSpan.
member.remarks: This subtracts OverheadTicks from the measured ticks to compensate for overhead.
member.param: The starting DateTime.
The stopping DateTime.
member.returns: A new TimeSpan.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.TestSelf
member.summary: A simple self test.
member.returns: bool - true for test passed, false for failed

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.NowTicks
member.summary: Gets the tick count from the clock.
member.remarks: No adjustment is made to this due to OverheadTicks.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.Now
member.summary: Return a DateTime which represents the current time. This is similar to DateTime.Now, but is higher resolution.
member.remarks: No adjustment is made to this due to OverheadTicks.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.OverheadTicks
member.summary: The minimum duration that this class is able to measure. This is measured during Calibrate(). This represents the number of ticks it takes to make a duration measurement, and is therefore the effective resolution of this class. This is subtracted from all duration calculations, which should compensate for the clock read overhead.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.HighResClock.Frequency
member.summary: This returns the number of high performance counter ticks (NOT .Net ticks) per second, as measured by Kernel32.dll's QueryPerformanceFrequency() function.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.MathUtil.NM_PER_DEGREES
member.summary: The number of international nautical miles in one degree along the Equator. 1 international nautical mile equals 1852m or 0.998383 equatorial arc minutes. Thus 1 equatorial arc degree equals 60.097177 international nautical miles. This differs from the geographical mile or historical nautical mile, which equal 1 arc minute along the equator or the meridian respectively.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.MathUtil.METERS_PER_NM
member.summary: The number of meters in one international nautical mile.

member.param: The cosine
member.returns: arc-cosine for x

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MathUtil.GreatCircle(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the distance (in radians) between 2 latitude/longitude pairs over the surface of a sphere.
member.param: latitude 1 in radians
longitude 1 in radians
latitude 2 in radians
longitude 2 in radians
member.returns: The distance over the surface of a sphere between the latitude/longitude pairs.
member.remarks: A great circle is a circle drawn around the surface of a sphere. Both sphere and circle share the same center, and for any two given points (the latitude/longitude pairs) on the sphere's surface there is a unique great circle. The smallest arc between the two points on the great circle describes the shortest distance between the two points.

member.param: The point to interpolate from.
The point to interpolate to.
The interpolation factor. Use 0.1 for a point near A, 0.9 for a point near B, and 0.5 for a point exactly between A and B.
member.returns: The interpolated point.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MathUtil.Distance(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon},System.Int32@,Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Returns the length (measured in radians) to the line segment of the 'points' array that lies closest to 'p'.
member.param: The points that make up the line.
Set to indicate which line segment is closest to 'p'. This is zero-based.
The point to query against the line.
member.returns: The distance to the line in radians.
member.remarks: The LatLon array points represents a series of line segments, for example points[0] -> points[1], points[1] -> points[2]. Given the LatLon point p, segment is set to indicate which line segment from the points array lies closest to p.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MathUtil.Distance(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Calculates the segment (angle measured in degrees) in the 'points' array that lies closest to 'p'.
member.param: The points that make up the line.
Set to indicate which line segment is closest to 'p'. This is zero-based.
The point to query against the line.
The index of the point in the points array that defines the start of the line.
The index of the point in the points array that defines the end of the line.
member.returns: The distance to the line in radians.
member.remarks: The LatLon array points represents a series of line segments, for example points[0] -> points[1], points[1] -> points[2]. Given the LatLon point p, segment is set to indicate which line segment from the points array lies closest to p.

members.member:
The DistanceUnit is used when requesting distance conversions.
Distance is first calculated in nautical miles by: NM = radians_distance * 180.0 * 60.0 / pi Conversion to the desired distance is then carried out by the formulas given above, where NM stands for nautical miles.
ConvertUnits and .

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.BackgroundThread
member.summary: Enumeration used to control whether or not a thread created by GBThread is a background thread.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.GBThread
member.summary: Utility class to create threads, which helps ensure that all threads are named and have an appropriate Repository as their CurrentThreadRepository.
member.remarks: Typically the caller will specify Repository.CurrentRepositoryOrNull as the new thread's Repository. This allows the new thread to use the calling thread's CurrentThreadRepository (if it has been set explicitly), otherwise the new thread will use the application's Repository.Default.

member.summary: Creates and starts a thread.
member.param: The delegate representing the method to run on the new thread.
The Repository to set as the new thread's CurrentThreadRepository.
The name of the new thread.
The priority of the new thread.
Whether the new thread is a background thread.
member.returns: The new thread.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter
member.summary: Records the cumulative distance (as the crow-flies) traveled from a starting point through a number of other points.

remarks.para: This is useful for recording the total distance traveled along a route consisting of a number of points.
Consider using a RouteMatrix if you'd like to calculate the distance between stops on a route.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon,System.Double)
member.summary: Construct a DistanceMeter with a start point and an initial distance (in radians) already traveled.
member.remarks: The cumulative distance traveled is referred to as the delta.
member.param: Starting point.
Initial Distance in radians.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a DistanceMeter with no starting point and zero distance already traveled.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.Add(Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon)
member.summary: Add a new point. The distance from the previous point to this point (as the crow flies) is calculated and added to the total distance traveled.
member.param: The next point in the route.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.AddPoints(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Telogis.GeoBase.LatLon})
member.summary: Add a list of points. Equivalent to calling Add for each point in the list.
member.param: The list of points to add to the DistanceMeter

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.ClearFull
member.summary: Clears both the accumulated distance and the last point.
member.remarks: Distance is calculated between two (or more) points, so no distance will be accumulated until at least two points have been added.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.ClearDelta
member.summary: Zero the distance traveled, but retain the last point on the route.
member.remarks: Useful when only the length of the current segment on a route need be known.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.Distance(Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Get total distance traveled (as the crow flies) from the starting point, through any intermediate points, to the last point that was added.
member.param: Units of distance that the result should be returned in.
member.returns: The distance traveled in the units specified.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.Clone
member.summary: Returns a clone. Operations performed on the clone are independent.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceMeter.Miles
member.summary: Returns the current distance traveled between all points (as the crow flies) in miles.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedMeter
member.summary: Records the average speed given points and timestamps.
member.remarks: This is useful for recording the average speed along a route consisting of a number of points.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.MultiHashMap
member.summary: A MultiHashMap is a that puts objects with the same key values into an .
member.remarks: This class uses ArrayLists to store objects that collide (have the same key value). When queried for a key value, an ArrayList of all objects with that key is returned.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MultiHashMap.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a MultiHashMap where the underlying has the default capacity.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MultiHashMap.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a MultiHashMap where the underlying is constructed with the given capacity.
member.param: The initial storage capacity.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MultiHashMap.Add(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Stores the given object at a location determined by its key value.
member.param: The key for the object that is being added.
The object to be added.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MultiHashMap.Remove(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the given object with the given key value.
member.remarks: Unlike a both the object to be removed (val) and a key value are required by this method. It is not sufficient to supply only a key, as this does not allow the distinct object to be determined where there are multiple objects with the same key.
member.param: The key for the object that is being removed.
The object to be removed.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.MultiHashMap.GetList(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets an of objects that have the same key value.
member.param: The key of the object(s) to be returned.
member.returns: An of objects matching the key. If none match, an empty ArrayList is returned.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator
member.summary: A class to calculate the estimated time of arrival (ETA)

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.MinRatio
member.summary: Minimum value for ratio. We don't expect anyone to go more than 3x the calculated speed for any appreciable distance.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.MaxRatio
member.summary: Maximum value for ratio. Anyone going 10x slower than the calculated speed for a sustained period will be considered stopped (see StoppedLimitTicks).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.StoppedLimitTicks
member.summary: Number of ticks we can be stopped for before we stop putting data in the window.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.TickLengthSecs
member.summary: Duration between ticks.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.WindowSizeTicks
member.summary: Number of ticks in the window.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_slidingWindow
member.summary: Every tick (unless stopped) the change in estimated time is stored in the sliding window. The ratio is calculated by (TickLengthSecs * WindowSizeTicks) / Sum(m_slidingWindow).

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_prevTickRealTime
member.summary: The time when the most recent non-stopped tick occured. If this was more than 2 hours ago the window is reset.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_prevTickEstTime
member.summary: The estimated time since the start of the route at the previous tick.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_currentEstTime
member.summary: The most recently calculated estimated time since the start of the route.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_stoppedCount
member.summary: The number of ticks we have been stopped for.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_timeRemaining
member.summary: Most recent calculated value for the time remaining on the route.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.m_expectedTime
member.summary: Expected route time.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.SetExpectedTime(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Set the expected route time.
member.param: The expected route time.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.ETACalculator.TimeRemaining(System.DateTime,System.Double,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate the estimated time remaining for this route.
member.param: The current time.
The speed (rad/s) that we expect to travel along the current link. Must be > 0.
The expected time for the start of the current link.
The expected time for the end of the current link.
The length (rad) of the current link.
The distance (rad) to the next intersection.
member.returns: The estimated time remaining for this route.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.DirectionsGenerator.IsIllegalTurn(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines whether the turn we're processing is one we should try to avoid.
member.param: If true then for the current route we should consider the turn illegal, but when we re-run instead of adding a constraint with speed 0 we should add a constraint with a slow speed. This is for U-turns that are legal but are a manoeuvre we'd like to avoid if possible.
member.returns: Whether or not the turn should be treated as illegal.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.PoiRenderer

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer
member.summary: Implements a licensing server over a web service.
member.remarks:
To implement your own licensing server, derive from this class in your web service file and override the Validate method. This method gets a copy of the complete signed license requesting validation. The default implementation automatically returns true.
You can use this server to implement a central license registraion service.

member.name: F:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.Headers
member.summary: Additional custom headers to include with all web request calls.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LicenseServer class.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.UseClientCulture
member.summary: When called from a web method, switches the current thread's culture to match the client's culture.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.Unregister(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Un-registers a previously signed license for later validation.
member.param: The signed license as an XML string to validate.
Name of the assembly whos key file was used to sign the licenses. The public key is embedded in the component's assembly. The private key is stored securely on the license server's machine
member.remarks:
The license server must have full access to the original signing keys used to sign the license to enable validation.
Inerhitors should not call the base class's Validate method.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.Register(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a previously signed license for later validation.
member.param: The signed license as an XML string to validate.
Name of the assembly whos key file was used to sign the licenses. The public key is embedded in the component's assembly. The private key is stored securely on the license server's machine
member.remarks:
The license server must have full access to the original signing keys used to sign the license to enable validation.
Inerhitors should not call the base class's Validate method.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.RegisterEx(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a license with additional user information. A new license can optionally be generated in response to the registration.
member.param: The signed license as an XML string to validate. May be null.
Name of the assembly whos key file was used to sign the licenses. The public key is embedded in the component's assembly. The private key is stored securely on the license server's machine
Indicates if a new license for the user should be generated. The license should have it's serial number set to the value in the serialNumber parameter.
The serial number included in the registration. This may or may not have been entered by the user.
Collection of values from the registration form. Use the to read the values.
member.remarks:
Two types of license registration are available. Either registering an already purchased license or creating a new one in response to a setup process. This way publishers can gather contact information when the user installs their application.
Values XML Reference
Name Description
FirstName The first name provided in the registration form.
LastName The last name provided in the registration form.
MiddleName The middle name provided in the registration form.
Organization The name of the organization provided in the registration form.
AssemblyVersion The version of the assembly being registered.
FileVersion The version of the file being registered.
ProfileHash The hash of the of the client machine.
member.returns:
When generateLicense is false this method may return null. When true it returns the XML of the new license pack. Note The return value is a which may include one or more licenses. At least one of them should have the serial number set to the value passed in the serialNumber parameter.
The base implementation calls if the licenseXml is not null.Inheritors should not call the base implementation when overriding the method.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.IsRegistered(Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense)
member.summary: Determines if the license has been registered with the server.
member.param: The license to look for.
member.returns: Returns true if the license was previously registered, otherwise false.
member.remarks: The base implementaiton allways returns false. You should override this method if you store registration information in a database or other storage medium.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.Validate(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates a previously issued license.
member.param: Name of the assembly whos key file was used to sign the licenses. The public key is embedded in the component's assembly. The private key is stored securely on the license server's machine
The signed license as an XML string to validate.
Salt used to ensure the response from the server is not intercepted or altered.
member.remarks:
The license server must have full access to the original signing keys used to sign the license to enable validation. A random string is generated (salt) from the ExtendedLicenseProvider and is then signed and returned on success.
Ineritors should call the base class's Validate method and capture the return value for success.
member.returns: Returns a signed response if valid otherwise throw an exception. The response is the signed version of the salt using the same signing keys used to sign the license.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.ValidateEx(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates a previously issued license.
member.param: Name of the assembly whos key file was used to sign the licenses. The public key is embedded in the component's assembly. The private key is stored securely on the license server's machine
The signed license as an XML string to validate.
Salt used to ensure the response from the server is not intercepted or altered.
The hash of the of the client machine requesting the license be validated. Use to uniquely identify a given machine.
Additional values reserved for later use.
member.remarks:
The license server must have full access to the original signing keys used to sign the license to enable validation. A random string is generated (salt) from the ExtendedLicenseProvider and is then signed and returned on success.
Ineritors should call the base class's Validate method and capture the return value for success.
This method simply calls the default method unless overridden in a derived class.
member.returns: Returns a signed response if valid otherwise throw an exception. The response is the signed version of the salt using the same signing keys used to sign the license.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.GetTrialLicense(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a new trial license on-demand for the assembly with the given name.
member.param: The name of the assembly to get a trial license for.
A profile hash of the computer that the trial is being requested from. Developers can use this to determine if a new trial license should be granted.
The value of the property for the declared for the assembly.
member.returns: Returns a new XML license pack for the assembly.
member.remarks:
Trial licenses can be generated for new installations of an assembly. The profile hash represents a machine profile that developers can use to determine if a trial license has been requested for that machine before.
The base implementation throws an exception indicating that new trial licenses are not supported.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.RenewLease(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a new volatile license according to the lease terms in the original license.
member.param: The name of the assembly whos keys should be used when signing the license.
An XML string representing the original license.
A profile hash of the machine requesting the renewal. The volatile leased license will be locked to the machine making the request.
member.remarks:
Leased licenses can be used to reduce network traffic, improve reliability, and improve performance. A leased license is essentially a short term durable validation from a license server. Once a leased license has been validated a leased copy is requested. This leased copy expires according to the and does not include the original license server limit, so no further checks are made back to the license server during the lease time.
The base implementation Validates the license, removes the original , and adds an with 0 tolerance and no activation server, signs the license and returns that copy.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.GetSigningKey(System.String)
member.summary: Internal helper method used to get a signing key pair given the name of the original signing keys.
member.param: Name of the key files used to sign licenses.
member.returns: Returns a new signing key. If the keys were not found an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Xheo.Licensing.LicenseServer.GetSigningKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Internal helper method used to get a signing key pair given the name of the original signing keys.
member.param: Name of the key files used to sign licenses.
Path to the folder that contains the keys. If null then the default is used.
member.returns: Returns a new signing key. If the keys were not found an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.ImageUtils.IconCache
member.summary: Allows icons to be rendered efficiently on maps. Manages instances of icons and can perform rotation and creation of icons.

remarks.para: A number of icons are included already in the IconCache. Additional icons can be added at runtime using . s or custom s can be used to render icons on maps.

The default display position of an icon is with its center placed over the specified co-ordinates. If this is not appropriate for an icon, its center position may be adjusted by specifying offset parameters called hotspots. These parameters tell the icon cache to shift the icon before rendering it. An example would be an arrow icon whose point should be rendered over the specified map co-ordinates.

member.remarks: The hotspot refers to the point on the image used for positioning the icon. For example, a pin icon would likely have the hotspot set to the tip of the pin. This would ensure that when the icon is positioned it will have the point of the pin placed accurately.

X coordinate of hotspot (relative to top left of icon)
Y coordinate of hotspot (relative to top left of icon)

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.ImageUtils.IconCache._Icon.hot_x
member.summary: When rendering an Icon at a given location, hot spot co-ordinates are used to position a certain part of the Icon over the location.
member.remarks: Hot spot co-ordinates should be used when the shape of the Icon is such that positioning the centre of it over a location is not desirable. The hot spot co-ordinates ensure that the point of the balloon is located at the rendered co-ordinates.
member.example: Co-ordinates are specified as offset values: A hot_x value of 5 will cause the center of the Icon to be rendered 5 pixels to the right of the location co-ordinates.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager
member.summary: The NavigationManager is a simple drop-in class to provide navigation services with the help from UI controls.
member.remarks:
Navigation services provided by the NavigationManager include visual route guidance, audible announcements and GPS filtering. The NavigationManager can provide feedback using UI controls: a (to guide the user through upcoming turns) and es to display the current address, speed, destination and ETA. These controls may be set using the method.
Related articles: Navigation Tutorial, Implementing an IGps Member, Using Languages and Cultures.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.MapCtrl,System.String)

member.remarks: The default voice files are stored in the 'voices' directory of the default datapath. See
member.param: Path to voice files.
member.remarks: This constuctor remains for back-compatibility with code written against GeoBase 3.0.5 or earlier. Code written against GeoBase 3.0.7 or later should use the other constructors, which have improved support for internationalization.

Whether to perform all language-based operations in debug mode.
member.remarks: When in debug mode, the NavigationManager will raise s when errors are found in the language configuration file, and will print to the console the names of sound files as they are played. When errors are found in the language configuration file and the NavigationManager is not in debug mode it will proceed on a best effort basis.

member.summary: Replace all ZoomLevel s with specified levels. Initial ZoomLevel is specified with initialZoom. The values set using this method are used when MapControlMode is set to FixedZooms or if MapControlMode is set to DynamicZooms.
member.remarks: If zoom levels are not inserted in ascending order, an exception will be generated. Note that initialZoom is an index into the array.
member.param: Zoom levels. This array must be sorted by zooms in ascending order.
The index into the zooms array which is the zoom level the navigation manager should be set to.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.GetZoomCrossoverSpeed(Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Get the zoom crossover speed in the given units. This value returned is used when MapControlMode is set to CrossoverZoom.
member.returns: The zoom crossover speed for this map. If the current GPS speed is less than this value, the map will zoom to the SlowZoom level. Otherwise the FastZoom level will be used.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.SetZoomCrossoverSpeed(System.Double,Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Set the zoom crossover speed in the given units. The zoom crossover speed is used to define the speed-dependent boundary between a close zoom (when traveling at a rate less than the zoom crossover speed) and a far zoom (when traveling faster than the zoom crossover speed). The value of the zoom crossover speed is used when MapControlMode is set to CrossoverZoom.
member.param: The desired zoom crossover speed
member.remarks: See also GetZoomCrossoverSpeed

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.LoadRoutingProfile(System.String)
member.summary: Load a speed routing profile (with speeds measured in miles per hour) from a given text file. See remarks.

remarks.para: Each line in the file represents a functional class (1-6). The first line represents functional class 1, the second line functional class 2, etc. Each line contains a maximum of 8 comma-delimited speed category values (in miles per hour). The first value in each line corresponds to speed category 1, the second value corresponds to speed category 2, etc.

The following is an example of the contents from a routing profile text file. This particular routing profile assumes that speed values for functional classes 1 through 4 are independent of the functional class (each of the first four functional classes, or rows, are identical).

member.param: The path to the file

remarks.para: Each line in the file represents a functional class (1-6). The first line represents functional class 1, the second line functional class 2, etc. Each line contains a maximum of 8 comma-delimited speed category values (in miles per hour). The first value in each line corresponds to speed category 1, the second value corresponds to speed category 2, etc.

The following is an example of the contents from a routing profile text file. This particular routing profile assumes that speed values for functional classes 1 through 4 are independent of the functional class (each of the first four functional classes, or rows, are identical).

member.param: The path to the file

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.FreeLook
member.summary: Allows the map to be freely panned and zoomed.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.TwoDRecenterBorderSize
member.summary: When the MapCtrl is in MapPerspective.TwoD mode and the NavigationManager.Orientation is MapOrientation.North, the map is only redrawn when the vehicle icon enters a border region around the edge of the map. This property controls the size, in pixels, of that border region.
member.remarks: If the border size is at least half of either the width or the height of the MapCtrl then the map is redrawn every time the vehicle moves by at least 1 pixel. By default the border size is int.MaxValue, making that behavior the default.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.RequiredRendermodes

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.MapMode.DynamicZooms
member.summary: Zoom is based on vehicle speed, and distance to the approaching navigation event. The speeds at which zooming occurs can be set by calling . The distances from next navigation event at which zooming occurs can be set by calling .

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer
member.summary: The DynamicZoomer provides an interface for controlling zooming behavior of the map based on the vehicle's speed and distance from approaching navigation event.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.SetZoomAtSpeed(System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedValue,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets a speed at which the map will initiate zooming. This may be called multiple times to initiate zooming at different speeds.
member.remarks: Hysteresis
member.param: The percentage to modify the current zoom level by at this speed, e.g. 100 is no change, 200 would double the current zoom level. A number greater than 100 represents the map zooming out for a wider view.
The speed at which to initiate zooming. If the vehicle is traveling faster than this speed the map will zoom by the provided percentage.
The length of time the zoom transition is to take.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.SetZoomAtDistance(System.Int32,System.Double,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets a distance from the next approaching nav event at which to initiate zooming. This may be called multiple times to zoom at different distances.
member.param: The percentage to modify the current zoom level by at this distance, e.g. 100 is no change, 200 would double the current zoom level. A number greater than 100 represents the map zooming out for a more broad view.
The distance at which to initiate zooming.
The unit system of the above distance.
The length of time zooming transistion is to take.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.Clear
member.summary: Clears the currently set dynamic zoom behavior.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.PerspectiveMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the DynamicZoomer's current PerspectiveMode. The default behavior is dynamic zooming is only in effect for two-point-five-d maps.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.HysteresisLimit
member.summary: Dynamic zooming has an optional hysteresis feature to prevent the map jumping between zooms when vehicle speed is hovering about the zoom-out limit. Vehicle speed must drop HysteresisLimit below the zoom out speed before the map will zoom into the next lowest level.
member.remarks: The HysteresisLimit is a buffer between crossover levels specifying the absolute minimum speed spacing between them. For example, a HysteresisLimit value of 15 dictates that no crossover levels can be less than 15 km/h from one another. The HysteresisLimit also prevents the map zoom jumping between two zoom levels when speed sits near a zoom-out boundary. For example, with a crossover value of '50' and a HysteresisLimit value of '10', the map will zoom out when the vehicle speed reaches 50 km/h, but will not zoom in again until the vehicle's speed has dropped below 40 km/h. When a NavigationManager is constructed, a default HysteresisLimit of 10 km/h is set. To clear this default value and set your own, DynamicZoomSettings.Clear(); should be used.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.PerspectiveModes
member.summary: An enumeration used for controlling the map perspectives for which the DynamicZoomer will be in effect.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.PerspectiveModes.TwoPoint5DOnly
member.summary: Dynamic zooming will only occur when the map is in 2.5D mode. This is the default setting.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.NavigationManager.DynamicZoomer.PerspectiveModes.AnyPerspective
member.summary: Dynamic zooming will occur regardless of the map's current perspective mode.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.INavigationStatus.SetAddress(Telogis.GeoBase.Address,Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.DisplayNameMode)
member.summary: Derived classes should implement this method to notify the user of a change of address.
member.remarks: Typically, a navigation-based application will show a to display the current location of the vehicle. This method should then be implemented to update the LabelBox with the new address information. If the displayNameMode is then the should be used. Otherwise use so that the Navigation display setting is adhered to.
member.param: The most recent .
The way in which to display the address according to .

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.INavigationStatus.SetSpeed(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,Telogis.GeoBase.SpeedUnit)
member.summary: Derived classes should implement this method to notify the user of the vehicle's current speed.
member.param: The current speed limit (measured in units)
True if the speed limit is a posted speed limit, or an implied speed limit
The current speed of the vehicle (again, measured in units)
The s in which the speed limit and vehicle speed are measured

remarks.para: Typically, a navigation-based application will show a to display the current speed (passed as the vehicleSpeed parameter) of the vehicle. This method should then be implemented to update the LabelBox with the new speed information.
The current speed limit is also passed to this method (as the speedLimit parameter) so your application may alert the user (audibly and/or visibly) if the user is exceeding the speed limit.

The instruction to perform after the specified distance has been traveled
member.remarks: Typically, a navigation-based application will show a to display instructions for upcoming navigation events. This method should then be implemented to update the LabelBox with the distance to (passed as the distance parameter), and action (passed as the instruction parameter) to take at, the next navigation event.

member.param: GPS status information
member.remarks: Typically, a navigation-based application will show a to display GPS status information (eg, "Searching for satellites: no fix"). This method should then be implemented to update the LabelBox with the given GPS information (passed as the info parameter).

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.DefaultNavigationStatus.MessagesBundle
member.summary: Provides access to messages (for example strings and announcements) for a single culture. This class is abstract and has concrete subclasses that vary according to how the messages are configured, for example from an XML string or from an XML file in a directory on disk. By referencing instances of this abstract class rather than the concrete subclasses, the same code can access messages regardless of how they are configured.

member.summary: Finds a from a given and name(s) of the last known location and maximum (estimated) distance from that location.
member.remarks: The global flag controls the fallback state of the query. If global is true and the location cannot be resolved to a street address then the nearest city within 10 degrees is returned. This means that a successful resolution is almost certainly guaranteed (unless the is located in an ocean), however there is a significant performance hit in finding the nearest city.
member.param: Remote repository containing GeoBase map data
An array of strings representing the name(s) of the last known location.
The maximum distance (measured in degrees) we expect to be from the last known location.
If true and an address cannot be found a nearby city is returned. If false and an address cannot be found, the Reverse GeoCode will return a null . See Remarks.
Controls the type of streets that are returned by the search.

member.name: T:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense
member.summary: Primary class for the XHEO|Licensing framework.
member.remarks:
Each in an assembly can be protected by XHEO|Licensing. The environment that the Type is allowed to run in, is defined by a collection of instances defined for the license. For instance the license may limit a component for use on a computer with a specific IP address. These limits are implemented and enforced by subclasses of the class.
To ensure that the license files have not been altered since they were issued, each ExtendedLicense is signed with a . The signing key uses a public key encryption method (See ) with the public key embedded in the assembly that the component is implemented in. The private key remains secured with the original developers ensuring that only they can grant valid licenses.
License File Probing

member.name: F:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.ConfigSection
member.summary: The configuration section where XHEO|Licensing settings are stored in the application's configuration file.
member.remarks:
All of XHEO|Licensing's configuration settings can be set from the application or machine's configuration file. You can use the shared <appSettings> section or the custom section to set settings.
Most configuration options can be set in the configuration file via code by setting the public static property to the desired value. For example to save the location of the KeyFolder simply set to the desired value.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.TemplateFolder" value="X:\Keys" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="TemplateFolder" value="D:\aaa" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.MinimumSerialNumberSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum serial number seed value accepted by this license. Use to partition serial number seeds to various vendors.
member.remarks: Use MinimumSerialNumberSeed and to partition serial numbers to various resellers or vendors. You can then use this to determine which vendor sold your product in case of support requests.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.MaximumSerialNumberSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum serial number seed value accepted by this license. Use to partition serial number seeds to various vendors.
member.remarks: Use and MaximumSerialNumberSeed to partition serial numbers to various resellers or vendors. You can then use this to determine which vendor sold your product in case of support requests.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if the user must provide a valid serial number to fully unlock the license.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.IsUnlocked
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the license uses Unlock By Serial and the license has been unlocked. Even if the value is true, that does not indicate that the serial number is valid.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.AcceptedSerialNumberSizes
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial number sizes that can be used to unlock the license. If a valid serial number of a different size is used, license validation will fail.
member.remarks: It is recommended that you only allow the largest size you will reasonably expect to issue to your customers. A malicious user needs only to crack the smallest acceptable size to gain access to the license. The Recommended sizes are Medium (for regular serial numbers) and Huge (for activation keys).

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.AbsoluteSerialNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial number for the license.
member.remarks:
Generally the value of the serial number property is completely arbitrary and can contain any value. However the values should be treated as a primary key that uniquely identifies the license. Generally this is used to reference licenses in a back-end system and to uniquely identify the license.
By default a random GUID is generated for the serial number. You can later change it to any desired value.
(Version 1.2+) When using Unlock by Serial to unlock licenses, the Absolute Serial Number is used to match user's serial numbers to licenses.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.SerialNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the absolute serial number.
member.remarks: The absolute serial number is used in unlocking a license by serial number. The absolute serial number must begin with the for the license. Warning This value is unprotected and can be changed by the client. Do not assume the value is valid.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.Values
member.summary: Gets a collection of arbitrary values to store with the license.
member.remarks: You can use this to store values for runtime adjustments such as maximum values, names, etc. The values are also signed so adjustments to the values after the license has been signed will invalidate the license. Non primitive values must be marked as Serializable.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.MetaValues
member.summary: Gets a collection of arbitrary values to store with the license. These values are not protected and may be changed without affecting the validity of the license. Use for storing volitle information and other unsecured information.
member.remarks: The MetaValues collection will be persisted with a license. However any changes to the meta values collection after the license is signed will not affect the validity of the signature. Use this to track volitle information that need not be secured and is safe for the user to change.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.Expires
member.summary: Gets or sets the expiration date for the license.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.IssuerUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to the company that issued the license.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an arbitrary piece of data to track with the license. This is a "cheap" way of extending the license scheme by allowing you to store any kind of additional data that can be saved as a string to the license.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets an application/product specific description of the type of license. For examples "designer", "single user", "non-profit", etc. This can often be used a reference to the primary key in a database, such as a SKU, for the product that the license represents.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.PublicKey
member.summary: Gets a reference to the being used to validate the license.

member.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the license as an XML string fragment.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.InvalidReason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason the license was not valid. If Validate returns true this is an empty string.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.LicensedType
member.summary: Gets the Type the license was/will be granted to.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.IsEmbedded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if the license was loaded from an embedded resource rather then an external .LIC file.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.SurrogateLicensePack
member.summary: Gets or sets a surrogate license pack to use if validation of this license fails.
member.remarks:
For limits that alter the current license, or download new licenses you can set this property so that the new or altered license pack is used instead. When is called on the current license, this is initially set to null. If Validate returns false, and this is not null then the license pack indicated in this property, if it contains a license, is used instead. If a surrogate license pack also defines a surrogate license, it will not be checked, the license provider only checks one level deep.
Generally you shouldn't set this to a license pack containing license with with a Trial limit or GUI limit because it will interfere with the optimal license selection of the license provider.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.KeyFolder
member.summary: Gets the folder where the license keys are located as defined in the application's config file.
member.remarks: You can configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.KeyFolder and set it to the path where keys are stored on your machine.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.KeyFolder" value="X:\Keys" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="KeyFolder" value="D:\aaa" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.LicenseFolders
member.summary: Gets a collection of folders where the licenses are located as defined in the application's config file.
member.remarks:
Use this setting when you install XHEO|Licensing or licensed components into the GAC, or when using a shared install in a hosting environment.
You can configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.LicenseFolders and set it to the path where keys are stored on your machine.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.LicenseFolder" value="X:\Folder1" /> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.LicenseFolder" value="X:\Folder2" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="Xheo.Licensing.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.1.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=798276055709c98a" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="LicenseFolder" value="D:\aaa" /> <add key="LicenseFolder" value="C:\other" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.TemplateFolder
member.summary: Gets the folder where the license templates are located as defined in the application's config file.
member.remarks: You can configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.TemplateFolder and set it to the path where keys are stored on your machine.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.TemplateFolder" value="X:\Templates" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="TemplateFolder" value="D:\aaa\Templates" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets the default database connection string for licensing components.
member.remarks: You can configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.ConnectionString and set it to the path where keys are stored on your machine.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.ConnectionString" value="server=localhost;catalog=Northwind" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="ConnectionString" value="server=localhost;catalog=Northwind" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.SharedFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the shared license folder.
member.remarks:
The shared license folder is a location on the client machine where all XHEO|Licensing protected applications can look for licenses. This helps with shared hosting environments and large applications that may include multiple assemblies, some in the GAC. Rather then having .LIC files spread over the machine they can be located into a single location.
This is a machine wide setting. The value of this property should be considered configured by the machine's administrator. You should not change it as it will effect all installed applications protected with XHEO|Licensing.
The folder location by default is [Common Files]\Xheo\SharedLicenses. This can be configured per machine or per user in the registry at HKLM or HKLU\Software\Xheo\Licensing\SharedLicenseFolder.
See for settings you can apply to the application's config or machine.config file.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.Proxy
member.summary: Gets the Proxy to use when connecting to a web service.
member.remarks:
In most circumstances the default proxy settings for the machine will work for the user. However certain proxy configurations can cause communication problems with XHEO|Licensing. XHEO|Licensing uses the default proxy settings for the machine, when alternate settings are needed you can provide them in the registry at HKLM or HKLU\Software\Xheo\Licensing\ProxyAddress.
The value of the Proxy value in the registry should be the address of the proxy setting to use. If the value does not exist, XHEO|Licensing will use the machine's default settings. If it does exist they will override the machines settings. If the value exists, but is an empty string then no proxy will be used even if the machine defines one.
To supply proxy credentials add ProxyUsername and ProxyPassword values to the same key.
NoteThis is a machine wide setting. Care should be taken not to overwrite any existing settings when not necessary.
You can also configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.ProxyAddress and set it to the address of the proxy server. You can specify a username and password by using Xheo.Licensing.ProxyUsername and Xheo.Licensing.ProxyPassword.
If you specify settings in the registry and the config file, the settings in the config file will be used.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.ProxyAddress" value="http://proxy:8080" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="ProxyAddress" value="http://proxy:8080" /> <add key="ProxyUsername" value="user" /> <add key="ProxyPassword" value="password" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.IsTerminalServices
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the current session is running under terminal services.

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.DisableTrials
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if trial licenses are disabled.
member.remarks: You can configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.DisableTrials and set it to either true or false.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.DisableTrials" value="true" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="DisableTrials" value="true" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: P:Xheo.Licensing.ExtendedLicense.EmulateVersion
member.summary: Gets a value that determines the release version that XHEO|Licensing should emulate.

remarks.para: Use this value when migrating a solution from an earlier version to a newer one so that licenses generated with the new assembly will use the previous version until you have fully upgraded all dependent assemblies.
You can configure the value of this property in your application's configuration file. In the appSettings section add an entry for Xheo.Licensing.EmulateVersion and set it to either true or false.

example.code:
<configuration> <appSettings> <add key="Xheo.Licensing.EmulateVersion" value="1.1" /> </appSettings>
or
<configSections> <sectionGroup name="Xheo"> <section name="Licensing" type="System.Configuration.NameValueSectionHandler, System, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089" /> </sectionGroup> </configSections>
<Xheo> <Licensing> <add key="EmulateVersion" value="1.1" /> </Licensing> </Xheo> </configuration>

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Internationalization.MessagesBundle
member.summary: Provides access to messages (for example strings and announcements) for a single culture. This class is abstract and has concrete subclasses that vary according to how the messages are configured, for example from an XML string or from an XML file in a directory on disk. By referencing instances of this abstract class rather than the concrete subclasses, the same code can access messages regardless of how they are configured.

remarks.para: Related articles: Using Languages and Cultures, Accessing Messages.

member.summary: Adds a slice to this PieRing. A slice represents a single value for the variable represented by this PieRing. For example, a PieRing representing Vehicle Status might have slices of Moving (Green, 4 vehicles), Idle (Orange, 2 vehicles) and Stationary (Red, 7 vehicles).
member.param: The color to display the slice.
The number of items that are represented by the slice.

summary.para: A PieChart is used to represent the summary information of a cluster. A PieChart may have one or more variables, each represented by a PieRing. The PieRings for a PieChart should all have the same total count (which should equal the number of items in the Cluster it represents), and different radii so they will all be visible.

The PieRing with the largest radius is rendered first. The PieRing with the next largest radius is rendered on top, so that the only part of the first PieRing that's still visible is determined by the difference in the radii. And so on until the PieRing with the smallest radius is rendered on the very top. Finally the count of items in the cluster is rendered at the center of the PieChart.

summary.p: The low-order word contains the left-channel volume setting, and the high-order word contains the right-channel setting. A value of 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence. 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence.
If a device does not support both left and right volume control, the low-order word (left volume) of the specified location contains the mono volume level.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.TrafficSignalLocation
member.summary: Location of traffic signals in relation to a streetlink.
member.remarks: Traffic signals are only reported when the direction of travel is toward the signal. Thus, for example, if there are traffic signals on both ends of a street link that is part of a one-way street, the extra data for the street link will show only the signal at the end reached by the direction traffic is moving.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TrafficSignalLocation.None
member.summary: There is no traffic signal that can be reached by traveling to the end of this , or there is no data about traffic signals for this StreeLink.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TrafficSignalLocation.NonReference
member.summary: There is a traffic signal that can be reached by traveling to the nonreference end of this . That is, traffic an move from the reference end to the nonreference end of the street link and encounter a traffic signal when reaching the nonreference end.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TrafficSignalLocation.Reference
member.summary: There is a traffic signal that can be reached by traveling to the reference end of this . That is, traffic an move from the nonreference end to the reference end of the street link and encounter a traffic signal when reaching the reference end.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.TrafficSignalLocation.Both
member.summary: There are traffic signals at both ends of this (and traffic can move along this streetlink in either direction).

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.LinkExtraData
member.summary: Extra data for a street link. Currently, the only extra data available is the location of Traffic Signals

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.LinkExtraData.TrafficSignal
member.summary: Existence of traffic signals at either end of this link.
member.remarks: Traffic signal information is only available with Premium data, and only for road classes 1 through 4. Traffic signal information is available through GeoStream only with the link from ReverseGeoCodeFull. This data is compatible with GeoBase versions 3.x and greater.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator
member.summary: Provides methods and properties for a Navigator to route along a specified route comprising Waypoints.

remarks.para: For the Navigator to be able to use the route, create a route that contains only Waypoints, and then create a WaypointRouteCalculator with this route. Next, set the WaypointRouteCalculator as the Navigator's RouteCalculator.
For more information on Waypoints, see the API documentation, and the Routing and Directions topic in the GeoBase | Map Explorer section.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.Route)
member.summary: Creates a Waypoint route for the Navigator.
member.param: The Route comprising Waypoints. Ownership of this Route is passed to the WaypointRouteCalculator, which may modify and dispose of it. The route must have a defined Start value and End value, and every stop along the route must be a Waypoint. If the Start and/or End stop is undefined, or if there are no stops in addition to the Start and end Stop, the constructor throws a exception. If the route contains any stops that are not objects (i.e. RouteStop objects), the constructor throws an exception.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.SetVisitedThreshold(System.Double,Telogis.GeoBase.DistanceUnit)
member.summary: Sets the threshold for deciding when a Waypoint has been visited. The default is 300 ft.
member.param: The distance before a Waypoint has been deemed visited.
The units for the distance.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.DescribeNext
member.summary: This method is called by the navigator to describe the next turn on the route.
member.returns: Returns true if there are more turns to be described. The Navigator will call this repeatedly for a certain period of time so that the upcoming movement will always be described.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.IsRouteLegal
member.summary: Called by the Navigator to check whether the current route is free from constraint violations and if not, apply a routing constraint so that the next route calculated will be different.
member.returns: Returns true if the route is legal and hence does not need to be recalculated.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.UpdatePosition(Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.Position)
member.summary: Update the GPS position.
member.param: The current of the GPS unit.

remarks.para: If is true, then GPS points are only compared with the next unvisited Waypoint.

If is false, each time a GPS point comes in, it is compared with all Waypoints that have not been visited, and if it is within the threshold of one of them, then it and all previous Waypoints are marked as visited.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.RecalculateRoute(Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop,Telogis.GeoBase.RouteStop,Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RoutingStrategy,Telogis.GeoBase.Routing.RouteProgress)
member.summary: Does the work of recalculating the route.
member.param: The starting point of this route, e.g. current GPS Position.
Not used.
Not used.
Not used.

remarks.para: The parameters dest, strategy and RouteProgress are taken from the original route provided to the constructor.
When RecalculateRoute is called then the route has to go to the nearest point on the leg between the first unvisited waypoint and its previous waypoint.
For example:
Start - W1 - W2 - W3 - End

If W1 has not been visited then calculate the route from the original Start to W1. Find the geographically nearest point on that route to the current location and call it P. Calculate a route CurPos - P - W1 - W2 - W3 - End (to do so, set P as a temporary waypoint, but don't consider it when working out which waypoints have been visited or not - i.e. P is discarded as soon as the new route is calculated).
If W3 has not been visited then calculate the route W2 - W3. Find the geographically nearest point on that route to the current location and call it P. Calculate a route CurPos - P - W3 - End.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the WaypointRouteCalculator.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.WaypointRouteCalculator.ForceWaypointOrder
member.summary: Forces Waypoints to be visited in the correct order, if true. If false, then a Waypoint may be visited without one of the earlier ones having been visited. The default is true.

member.summary: Returns true if all the movements have been described in the route.

member.summary: Returns the for this route.

member.summary: Gets / sets the for this route.

member.name: T:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilterMode
member.summary: Describes the filtering level for a FilteredGps device.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilterMode.None
member.summary: No filtering is performed.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilterMode.Mild
member.summary: Filtering is only performed on the quality of the GPS signal.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilterMode.Aggressive
member.summary: Filtering is performed on the heading and fix type.

summary.para: In some instances (particularly at low speeds) a GPS device may report erroneous heading and speed information. FilteredGps encapsulates and filters the heading and location of a raw GPS device. It also provides the capability to report the location of the device ahead of time, using a prediction factor (see the FilteredGps constructor).
FilteredGps implements the IGps interface and may be used as a drop-in replacement for other GPS devices.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilteredGps.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.IGps,Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilterMode,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a new FilteredGps from a given source GPS device, a FilterMode and a prediction factor (in seconds, see remarks).
member.remarks: A prediction factor of 1 returns the filtered position of the GPS. A prediction factor of 2 returns the filtered position of the GPS, as estimated in 2 seconds time. This may be used to accurately display the position of the GPS whilst allowing for delays in map rendering.
member.param: An IGps member from which the GPS readings are taken
The GPS will return the estimated position of this GPS prediction seconds ahead of time.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilteredGps.PowerUp
member.summary: Power up the (inner) GPS unit.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilteredGps.PowerDown
member.summary: Power down the (inner) GPS unit.

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilteredGps.HeadingSpeedThreshold
member.summary: If the inner gps reports a speed lower than this threshold, then the heading information will be ignored

member.name: F:Telogis.GeoBase.Navigation.FilteredGps.FixTypeChangeBuffer
member.summary: This is the number of position updates that a fix must stay the same type before it will be considered to have changed to that type

member.summary: An eventhandler to be fired when the position of this GPS device is updated.

member.summary: Returns the IGps member encapsulated within this FilteredGps object.

member.summary: Determine the powered state of the (inner) GPS unit.

member.summary: Get the Position of the filtered GPS unit.

True if constraints should be honoured.

member.summary: Represents a set of GeoStream servers.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.#ctor(Telogis.GeoBase.Repositories.GeoStreamRepository,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new ServerSet from an array of server URLs.
member.param: The URLs of the GeoStream servers to use.
The parent GeoStreamRepository object.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.NextServer
member.summary: Instructs GeoStream to start using the next server in the list. If at the end of the list, this method will cause the current server to wrap around back to the beginning.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.TestServers
member.summary: Tests that the current server is a functioning GeoStream server.

member.name: M:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.GeoBaseVersion
member.summary: Gets the version of GeoBase running on the current server.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.Proxy
member.summary: This property is used to set the proxy server for the program to use when accessing the servers. By default no proxy is used and this returns a null reference.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.RequestTimeoutMs
member.summary: This property is used to change the Request timeout. The default timeout is 100,000 milliseconds. Ensure that the server is confiqured to serve a request of this timespan. In IIS the MaxSessionLength/Session timeout property may need to be greater than this timeout. Note that these settings may vary between IIS versions.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.Expect100Continue
member.summary: When this property is set to true this GeoStreamRepository object will wait for a 100 (Continue) header from the GeoStream server before sending a PUT or POST request body. This allows the GeoStreamRepository object to determine if the GeoStream server is willing to accept the GeoStream request.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.UseKeepAlive
member.summary: When true this object will attempt to open persistent connections to GeoStream servers, by setting the Connection HTTP header to 'Keep-Alive'.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.Servers
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of server URLs to use.

member.name: P:Telogis.GeoBase.GeoStream.ServerSet.CurrentServer
member.summary: Gets the URL of the server currently being used.
